text: Suasana teduh.cocok untuk istirahat dan menikmati pemandangan.lokasi strategis.berjalan kaki paling enak di sore hari.lobi kecil tapi cukup.kamar cukup nyaman dengan pelayanan ramah. Perlengkapan kamar mandi perlu ditambah.
title: Teduh, suasana

text: Lokasi hotel sangat strategis berada di pinggir pantai , dekat dengan tempat wisata yang lain. Hotel mempunyai 2 kolam renang air asin . Kombinasi pantai dan kebun yang dikelola dengan baik menghasilkan panoramanya yang sangat indah serta luar biasa. Receptionis menerima kami dengan baik dan ramah. Interior hotel juga sangat bagus. Penataan ruangan kamar hotel sangat tepat. Kamar dan kamar mandi sangat bersih. Wifi tersedia dan berjalan normal. TVnya juga berjalan dengan baik. Menginap disini dapat tidur pulas. Kami juga bisa berjemur dan berenang disini. Restonya menyediakan berbagai variasi menu makanan dan rasa masakannya lezat. Exterior hotel bener2 mengagumkan.
title: Hotel dengan Panorama Indah

text:
Service was impeccable from last minute reservation to our departure.

Warm welcome, attention to detail, great massage and spa at the hotel, great food, and also offer great excursions.

We stayed there for 4 nights, and joined one excursion to the National park.  Putu is a really great guide who works at the National Park.  He is really passionate and familiar with the park from Mangrove to all the species.  On top of that, the hotel contributes to the park conservation.

Th hotel has a nice breeze every day.  Although it was a dry season, we did not feel hot at all.  

The manager, Yes, is always there to check on you, making sure you are always comfortable.  He even went beyond and requested the kitchen to make us some local food that are not in the menu.

Highly recommended to stay at this hotel!
title: Perfect!

owner_response.text:
I am so happy you enjoyed your stay with us and thank you for the great review.

Carole,
Director
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
We spent four relaxing days in the quiet oasis of the Santi Sari hotel. This is a beautiful hotel set in acres of green and lush gardens. Our room was magnificent, the restaurant menu was extensive and all the dishes we had were delicious.
All of the staff were so friendly and went out of their way to meet every need.
Tracy & Andrew
title: Magical stay in an idyllic setting

text:
The entire staff was attentive to every detail.  Manager Yasrawi spoke with us daily to make certain that we were having a good stay.  He arranged for a day excursion to Menjangan Island for snorkeling.  He personally drove us to the Proyak Penyu turtle hatchery project, introduced us to founder Chris Brown and went on a short tour with us.  The on-stite massage therapists were excellent.  The 2 swimming pools are fantastic, mostly salt water w/ a small amount of chlorine.  Excellent meals.  Beautiful rooms. Highly recommended.

The hotel does not have any beach front, but it is a simple request to be driven to a nearby beach.
title: Highly Recommended

photos.caption: Walkway to dining area and guest suites
Walkway to excursion boat for snorkeling

text: We were met as soon as our vehicle arrived and immediately given a beautiful Hindu blessing.  The restaurant stayed open for us b/c they knew we were arriving late at night.  Everyone was so kind and we wish we could have stayed longer!
title: Attention to detail and service was impeccable

text:
We cannot stop talking about our unforgettable stay in Santi Sari. We would like to thank Tony, Carole and their wonderful staff once again for their kindness, attentiveness and sincere hospitality. We really felt cared for and we will be forever greatful for this. They have built a one-of-a-kind resort with such attention to detail and respect for its surroundings that it truly represents the definition of perfection. One of things we loved most is that the entire experience was pure, essential, nothing superfluous, from the environment to the decor and the people, just like the meaning of the word "sari". All this is a reflection of both of them, two very special people. 
We hope to be back again soon!
title: Pure perfection!

text: We were staying at another Hotel close by in Pemuteran, although it was nice we went on a bike trip to checkout some other spas. The area is all villages so there is not much around, but we were lucky enough to spot a trip advisor sign of Santi Sari. We followed the dirt tracks all the way to the Hotel, where we were blown away by the beauty of the gardens and facilities. After we had been shown around the hotel, we were treated to a complimentary drink and met the host Carol. She made us feel really welcome and after a short conversation we were invited to stay in one of the gorgeous suites, it was both romantic and comfortable. The food was delicious and we had the best Chakra aligning massages of all time. Highly recommended. Will be back again! Thanks so much to Carol and her family our new friends! Lenskii & Katya :D xxoxoxoxox
title: The Hosts Made Our Trip Very Special!

text:
the room is really large, nice and clean. All staff is very friendly and willing to take the extra step. Host Tony explained all possible outings, much appreciated! The snorkeling (with own boat) is an absolute GO! Also, our hikes with "Tattoo" were very interesting. The food (breakfast, lunch and diner) are well-priced and tasty. We like to eat relaxed, so tell the staff so they will not bring the course too quick following each other. Also, good wine-list, not too expensive. If we return to Bali, it will be here.
The really only minus: the mosque starting at 5am...
title: really great experience, with excellent host

text: As I was driving west along Bali's north coast I saw several signs advertising the Santi Sari Hotel - and its "gourmet cooking" so I planned to stop there for lunch.  The grounds and gardens are very attractive and the restaurant is set by the pool with wonderful sea views.  There is an extensive menu offering a huge selection of styles of food from Indonesian to Turkish to Chinese etc.  I had the gazpacho and an Indonesian spicy chicken dish.  Both were very tasty, beautifully presented and properly served.  The meals (and the rooms) are not inexpensive, but highly recommended for a special occasion
title: Great meal

text:
I got caught in monsoon rains driving through the mountain pass travelling to the northwest of Bali and arrived at the top of this dirt track off the highway and felt I needed to follow it. I didn't know what was at the end of it but I just needed to come here which is so bizarre. At the end of the road there ends up being this Oasis which is Santi Sari and I thought: okay I'll just have a drink here, get out of the rain and get my bearings. I end up meeting the owner Tony and as its low season get alot of facetime with him. We end up having an amazing metaphysical conversation at which time I decide to stay the night in the best suite here. We then had dinner and chatted until 3 o'clock in the morning! As a side bar I had lost my car keys and couldn't get any of my luggage out of the car so the entire staff searched high and low with flashlights to try and find them to no avail. Tony even lent me a shirt and bathing trunks to tide me over! The following morning after hours of fruitless searching a gardener found the keys at the bottom of the lotus pond! This saved me days if not weeks of pain with the rental agents.

Thankfully none of that detracted from a very transformative stay. The location, the staff, the food, the design qualities and style and in particular Tony were all top notch. Make the effort to stay here.
title: Transformative

text: From the moment we arrived you could feel the calmness and tranquility of the Santi Sari.  We were treated over and above by all the wonderful staff and the directors Carol and Tony.  The organised trips for us, catered for all our requirements. Accommodation was 1st class as was the food.  Never have I ever been to such a wonderful place.  A magical experience .... Thank you 😘
title: Magical

text:
If you are in this area of Bali and would like a five star experience I can not recommend this place enough.
The food, ambience and staff all added to a memorable experience .
The hotel is down a track don't give up it truly is there ... and well worth the persistence. Enjoy !
title: Amazing !!!!!

text: Recently I returned to Santi Sari Boutique Resort for 4 days. And again I am delighted to say, this little gem totally delivered! The friendly staff and owner's personalised, yet unintrusive attention to detail and service made our stay extra special. The accommodation and decor are understatedly elegant. The relaxation areas, gardens, pools, and day beds allow for a truly tranquil experience. The meals are delicious and ample, I also love the afternoon tea experience. This area is also an authentic experience of Bali, with world class snorkelling and diving at the nearby pristine marine park Menjangen Island - a must do excursion with the resorts own boat tour and national parks. A stay at Santi Sari is truly as the meaning of its name - 'Essence of Peace'.
title: This little gem consistently delivers

text: Santi Sari is located within a short boat ride to the spectacular coral reefs off the Bali national park.  The owners were warm and friendly folks who genuinely cared for us and ensured we had a great visit.  The property is wonderfully laid out and private.  Our pool was secluded and filled with soothing un-chlorinated salt water.  Skipping the tourist boats that shuttle visitors to the Menjangan Island coral reefs,  Santi Sari provided us their covered boat with driver and guide who personally dove with us to make sure we saw all the beauty the island reefs display.  Getting to the resort was easy as they arranged a driver at a nominal fee who met us at the airport and drove us directly to the property.  The dining at the resort was exceptional with fresh-caught fish and an array of local Balinese dishes.  We were impressed with the breadth of the menu.  The beach at nearby Pemuteran was a quick hop away with resort's shuttle service.  It has some nice coral (some uniquely man-made) and a sea turtle rescue operation you can see first hand. We had a really enjoyable stay at Sani Sari.
title: The quiet side of Bali

text: The Santi Sari is a truly magical place, Its a remote location with beautiful views of the ocean and mangroves. Me and my boyfriend were looking for a unique place that could completely relax and cleanse us from our daily stresses, the santi sari gave us that and so much more! Tony who owns the hotel, is a very special person and he went out of his way to make our stay as relaxing and amazing as we had hoped it would be. Even taking us to a special hindu ceremony in an incredible temple that i personally wanted to find but probably wouldn't have if he hadn't shown me. We went half board and it catered to all of our needs the food was wonderful and we even tried the traditional balinese dinner that we both enjoyed very much. The staff were extremely nice, very professional and always there if you needed anything. There are a great range of excursions you can book, we would recommend the snorkelling trip to menjangan island they have a private boat to take you across the journey is lovely with the local fishermen and women waving and smiling as you go past, lunch is also provided and the views are stunning with an incredible amount of fish and living coral. Tony also provides a fantastic tour guide who took us to java to climb Kawah Ijen volcano he was a great guy very entertaining and showed us a lot of things including the coffee plantations and stopping in the jungle on the drive so we could take photographs of a black monkey, and also taking me to buy some java coffee for a great price as i love coffee which was a nice thing, we would recommend both trips. On the whole santi sari is one of the most amazing places i have stayed and we would recommend it to anyone that is looking for a relaxing getaway & prefers something unique to a typical luxury resort. We will definitely be going back.
title: A magical place to unwind and relax.

text:
This beautiful hotel, designed according to Feng Shui principles, sits overlooking Penerusan Bay in remote north western Bali. Situated close to the West Bali National Park and about 20 minutes from Lovina on the road to Gilimanuk, Santi Sari ticks all the boxes for the true Bali getaway. From the luxuriously appointed villas to the family style dining area every detail has been considered in the context of authentic Bali. 
Santi Sari fits into its surroundings beautifully and even has a its own Balinese temple where the staff and locals carry out ceremonies on auspicious days, and as anyone who has been to Bali knows, there are a goodly number of those throughout the year. There are snorkelling and trekking adventures to be had if that's your schtick or one can just laze about, soaking up the serenity. 
This hotel is perfect for a romantic interlude, a honeymoon, for experienced travellers to Indonesia who seek out of the way destinations and for families with an adventurous spirit (who have moved on from the need for a "Kid's Klub").
title: A beautiful resort in the truest sense of the word.

text:
This hotel feels like it is at the end of the road in the middle of nowhere, which is amazing or limiting, depending on your mindset. The hotel is about 3.5 hours from Ubud if you don’t stop and depending on traffic. While it shows up as being in Pumuteran on many websites, it is actually about ten miles past the town. Once you get there, you will not be leaving much unless you have a car, so plan on a kind of “all inclusive” experience and just give in. Tony, the host, will take you on an outstanding personal boat trip to snorkel the remarkable reef (you will not be rushed or expected to swim back to the boat; the boat comes to you, and you will go to multiple spots to find the best sea life and conditions for the day), someone will cut you a green coconut out of a tree as you watch, for your afternoon refreshment when you return, the staff will give a massage in the beautiful sitting room upstairs as the breeze blows through and you listen to evening prayers from the local mosque, and you will get great advice on where to go and what to do if you are an intrepid traveller who doesn’t have it all planned out in advance. Tony has been traveling the area for years and knows what is not to be missed and what is just a tourist trap. He is an all-around great conversationalist with an interesting story. He offers many kinds of adventures and excursions that I am sure are fabulous.

I stayed for three nights as a solo traveller. There was another american family staying there for my first two nights, and I tagged along on the snorkeling trip that they booked (a minimum of two is needed to make a trip, so I got lucky). On my last day and night, I was the only guest and I took full advantage of the property, swimming in the two pools, lounging about and walking the dock. It was my first traveling day to do “nothing” and Santi Sari is the perfect spot for that. It is a healing place. My biggest critique is of the food. Admittedly, I am a very health-conscious eater and vegetarian and I don't like oily or fried food. Many of the veggie options were fried or had sauce and dressing that was both bland and too heavy or oily for me. I needed salt, pepper, lime juice and sambal to be content. Breakfast was fabulous and could be made however you prefer, which I figured out after a day or two. The fruit with yogurt and honey had to be my favorite, with tiny strawberries from the local mountains and fresh mint.

The rooms here are absolutely gorgeous, with elegant furniture, private sitting areas outside, spacious and gorgeous bathrooms, and many sweet spots on the property for you to hide away and relax. Your every need will be met, with a prices attached that are more American than Balinese, but a hotel like this in the U.S. would be hard to find and would still be at least three times the price for the degree of service and personal attention. I would go back in a heartbeat with a better understanding of what was in store. This property is extremely private and safe and would be an idyllic hotel for honeymooners. It is a very romantic and magical spot away from the crowds of the south. Don’t hesitate to stay here.
title: Beautiful and remote with personal service

text: The Santi Sari was a stunningly beautiful and peaceful retreat with a friendly and welcoming staff and world-class snorkeling and diving. The menu with its diverse international foods (the best we found in Bali) was matched by the excellent food preparation and ambience. Our room was magical with beautiful Balinese traditional furnishings. We would love to come back!
title: Santi Sari Boutique Hotel, a stunningly beautiful and serene retreat

text: Highly recommend !! Exquisite, charming and serene environment. Fabulous place to relax after a day of diving, snorkeling or touring. Very friendly and accommodating staff. Wonderful warm and friendly owner. Incredible massages and all the amenities of comfort.
title: Dr. And Mrs. John Griffin Atlanta , Georgia

text: This place is a magical place. The cottages and rooms were excellent...surrounded by a rainforest with a waterfall I couldn't have found a better place to wake up and relax in. They grow and prepare all their foods on site. Luxury and comfort have never been so nicely woven together to create the perfect Zen haven.
title: BEAUTIFUL AND SERENE

text:
A lovely hotel in the north of Bali. 
I was here 3 nights and took a day-trip to Menjangan islands for snorkeling. It was a wonderful experience. You need a boat and a guide to get there. The guide from the hotel was great. .

The food was good. The restaurant has a beautiful view on the ocean. There are a lot of vegeterian options which is great. Wifi is only available in the restaurant, but fine for me.

Room is big and also have a beatiful view on the ocean. Pools are great for cooling down.

With thanks to the lovely staff!
title: Loved it here

text: My husband and I have traveled extensively and stayed at many beautiful hotels, but I must say, this is one of my favorites. There is a bit of magic here- a truly special place. The view from our room made me never want to leave! The owners Tony and Carol, make you feel as if you are long lost friends. The food was some of the best we had on this trip (fresh fish off the boat everyday and fresh coconuts we watched the workers cut off the trees). It was a welcomed change to have a range of gourmet food to choose from after days of Balinese food. The staff is wonderfully trained and helpful- do not miss the massages! They were some of the best in Bali! There are only 10 rooms and we barely saw the 2 other couples that were there so we really felt like we had privacy in this idyllic setting. Tony invited us to their onsite temple to experience the full moon ceremony and it was fascinating to have this peak into the Hindu culture.  The snorkeling in amazing- I had read that this was the best place to snorkel on the island and I was not let down. The private boat and guide really make it a fantastic experience. I can't say enough good things about Santi Sari- just get there  as soon as you can! I can't wait to go back!!
title: Heaven on Earth

text:
If you need a place to unwind this is the place to do it, hosts gracious, food and service excellent, hotel grounds magnificent.  There are activities to do such as snorkelling, diving and exploring the national park.  I highly recommend this hotel.  Thank you Tony and Carole for a blissful 5 days of relaxation.

Sam and Holly
title: Peaceful and relaxing Oasis

text:
Santi Sari is an idyllic location and I would highly recommend the hotel to anyway who is travelling to Bali. We stayed for 2 weeks and enjoyed every minute. The hotel, built from scratch on a plot of land is beautiful and there is so much attention to detail - from the hand carved doors all made from local Balinese wood, to the luxurious 4 poster beds! Expect 5 star quality food with a range of local fish on the menu (I would recommend the Mahi Mahi) as well as a huge selection of other cuisines to suit all tastes. There is also a good range of Indonesian classics if you want to try the local food too. 

We felt at home the second we arrived, greeted by the lovely Yas at reception as well as Tony the owner who showed us to our suite (one of the Banyan rooms). After a long trip from the UK it was almost like we were dreaming when we saw the room.

In terms of things to do there are lots of activities that can be organised by the hotel. We were taken on a trip to Menjangan Island with Tony and the boat drive Nana who is also an experience snorkeler. Snorkelling around the coral reefs there was incredible and there are many fish to see as well as beautiful coloured coral. The hotel organised a lovely packed lunch for us and brought plenty of water and towels for our comfort.

Tony also took as to see the local temples in the area (the village of Permuteran) which were very special and we managed to witness a Sunday ceremony. Tony is extremely insightful and knowledgeable about Balinese culture and the Hindu religion so we felt like we learnt many things while we were there.

Overall I would highly recommend Santi Sari, even if just for one night or a 2 week break like us it is perfect for anyone looking to relax and be looked after very well. 

Thank you Tony and Carole we will be back soon!
title: Paradise in Bali

text:
Having no plans on staying, we drove from Seminyak to Permuteran in our own rented car and just before Permuteran signs popped up beside the road mentioning Santi Sari.
Having a look at the entrance and after having a great tour of the place we decided to stay. And what a stay it was... The hotel itself is made to almost perfection, with high quality standards, the staff is impeccable and 24/7 ready to make your day, the kitchen serves great dishes from almost all continents and the peace and quiet was addicting. We had the opportunity to spend time with the owner, making our stay even better. No request was too much and no effort spared to make us feel at home. This planned two nights stay turned into a 6 night stay, where me and my girlfriend feel that this hidden treasure was meant to cross our paths and we enjoyed it very, very much.
title: a hidden paradise on a paradise island

photos.caption: a perfect place to spend your day..

text:
my stay at Santi Sari was a wonderul experience.  traveling down a dirt rocky road was worth it, as the gardens and friendly staff greeted us as if we were a long lost friends.  The staff blessed my friend George and I on our arrival, and I immediately knew this was going to be fabulous.

my room had a marble  shower bigger than my bathroom at home....ha ha..true!!
and just wait untill you see the four poster carved bed and the amazing soft flowing drapery-mosquito net around it...when I awoke I felt like I was in a cloud, and the peace and serenity was indescribable.

I spent hours in the salt water pool, surrounded by magificant statues and lush green gardens, and attentive staff, who whilst still giving privacy were on hand to attend to any request with a big beautiful smile.

The food was wonderful, the menu show casing dishes from all corners of the world.

This hotel is a credit to it's founders Carol and Tony Anisworth, I'll be back!
title: if it's perfection your after look no further.

text:
I was thinking about how you could describe a place with such amazing energy, entering Santi Sari..via a little rocky road you reach Utopia, i have been to Bali many times and experienced what i always say to friends as 'heaven' though Santi Sari took my breath away... i smiled on the inside as i walked through the beautiful gardens, led along the paths to the exceptionally designed villas - they have thought of everything. The pools are divine, with the gentle sounds of the water features and birds ensuring you are somewhere very special. Snorkeling is a must... the best i have ever seen...i found nemo! it really is one of the best locations to snorkel/dive in the world - no exageration. i fondly remember exhaling after getting back on the boat thinking 'i have just had one of the best experiences of my life'..regardless of the sunburn :) 
food is exceptional, home made bread. Eating dinner whilst watching the swallors dip and dive in the water and then the transition from swollow to little cute bats.
I am very greatful for the experience and to meet Carol and Tony the welcoming owners.
I will be back again and again xxx lots of love and gratitude Bernita Edwards - Australia.
title: Utopia...Bliss

text: This hotel is just as close to perfection as you can get... Everything is refined and tasteful from the exquisite rooms to the wonderful restaurant and beautiful gardens... Special original touches such as the amazing beauty products customized especially for the hotel or the warm welcoming of the fascinating, charming and beautiful Carol make it a very special place you dream of going back to...
title: THE "PARADISE LOST" HAS BEEN FOUND

text:
Just called in here for lunch last week and were treated royally by Carol & Tony. The menu was Mediterranean/fusion. We were given 3 different spreads for our bread, which is just a small sign of the attention to detail. Must confess we had a pizza, which is often a disaster in another culture.  Not here. Thin and crispy, quality toppings. 
The hotel is just 1 year old this week. It looks sensational, with 10 suites in fabulous grounds & a private jetty & boat to take you to nearby islands. We already had accommodation elsewhere, but will certainly check it out next time. Not the place if you want a lot of nearby action, but just the place for a quality escape.
title: Lovely new place in a great environment

text: Learning back home via trip advisor about the Santi Sari we were looking forward to our stay in April 2011. Travelling first from South to the centre of Bali and then to the North, arriving late at night we were stunned by the beautiful (we would call it zen) architecture and surroundings by the Santi Sari hotel. By daylight the next morning looking around at architecture and garden you can see that beliefs and extraordinary good taste and attention to details are carried through hotel and garden. It is fascinating and refreshing. Walking to the jetty, taking a boat ride to Menjangan island, discovering the underwater world snorkeling was definetely a beautiful experience, going scuba diving was arranged close by, some beautiful smaller temples including cheeky but fun macaques to experience are around, swimming in the pool and being pampered at the restaurant or at the spa by the Santi Sari team completed a perfect stay for almost a week. On top it’s been very interesting, nice and a special experience to meet the owner of the hotel Tony whom we are very thankful for some good advices. If you want to spend some special time go there!
title: Awesome zen residence in the North of Bali

photos.caption: You just want to hopp in
Breathe in and breathe out to capture the moment
On our way to Menjangan island
Full view from the jetty side

text:
Our stay at Santi Sari was one of those beautiful surprises you get when you keep your eyes open and follow your nose. 
We found it only be seeing a small sign on the main road, and being exhausted travelers, we decided to check it out. So glad we did!
We came through the front gates to find a wide open green space with an incredible view of the ocean, and were greeted by the most welcoming staff team I've ever met!
We felt spoilt as soon as we walked through the gate. 
The rooms were at the top of the hill which overlooked the bay and menjangan island, and the rooms were so private that we felt like we had the whole place to ourself, and a pool of out very own. We didn't- we were nearby to another couple who were in exactly the same headspace as us - this resort isn't 'high density' accommodation, its spacious, peaceful and incredibly beautiful.
The staff and owners were the most welcoming, generous and hospitable people, and just made out stay so memorable. We joined them in a trip to the island and went snorkeling and ate lunch with them, and were accompanied on our trip back in the boat by a pod of dolphins and then the most beautiful lightning storm... Amazing, and sharing it with people who also appreciated it as much as we did made it twice as memorable!
This hotel has everything you could ask for if you want to relax and appreciate your surrounds and the peacefulness of Bali-
- amazing food
- beautiful staff
- luxury rooms and outdoor pool areas
- plenty of guided activities to do
- plenty of places to relax and take in the view.
We'll definitely be back!
title: Amazing experience!

text: We've been coming to Bali for many, many years.  On this trip we happened across a brand new hotel that we found to be spectacular. The owners, Tony and Carol have created a healing space of balance and delight. The energy of the hotel feels peaceful; the service is attentive and delightful, and the owners - one of whom is always there - wonderful people to get to know. One of the many highlights is their own boat, leaving daily from a private jetty, taking folks to the incredible coral reefs of Menjangan. The dive master, Nana could not have been more kind and attentive; as inexperienced snorkelers, we felt safe and protected. On a beautiful day we saw dolphins playing in the water, snorkeled over amazing coral and fish, ate a delicious picnic lunch, visited the island temple and saw wild deer up close. It was truly a perfect  and magical stay.  We will be back. Look them up on the web at santisarihotel.com. You'll be glad you did.
title: Beauty, magic, comfort and peace

text: It was as close to paradise as you come. The villas are immaculate, beautifully styled with amazing views of luxurious palms and tropical vegetation. The service was friendly, polite, warm and responsive. The owners have a presence there so they leave no detail up to chance. We spent a day snorkeling on one of the hotel boats and had a great time. The food was incredibly good not just cooking local specialities but alo had an international capability. The spigetti was as good as the best italian pasta in italy. The greek specialities of the chef were also wonderful.  I can not think of a thing to criticize.
title: Perfect luxury vacation in bali

text: Though we own a home on the south shores of Bali we are always traveling the island and looking for out of the way spots.  We happened upon Santi Sari on a stay in the north, had an excellent gourmet dinner and decided to return the following week for my husbands birthday.  We were delighted with the incredible attention to detail, relaxed atmosphere and luxurious accommodations.  We always look for the authentic experience by engaging with the Balinese staff (all locals with excellent English skills and the playful sense of humor we've come to love).  They could not have done more for us.  We spent some wonderful time with Tony and have to say we arrived as guests and left as friends.  Will look forward to many fun stays when Menjangan calls!
title: They have captured the essense of Bali

photos.caption: Lotus pond entry to rooms, pool & restaurant
From the Jetty looking at Santi Sari

text: I'm a world traveler and have stayed in many 5++ boutique hotels, resorts and villas.  Santi Sari is a must stay.  The property is well designed- conceptually/architecturally.  You can really sense the amount of details and thoughts that went into each villa and the landscape.  I woke up everyday with a smile and found myself just happy to be so relaxed and able to enjoy such a wonderful place.  Carol, the owner and her staff were extremely friendly and helpful. They were the icing on the cake!  Bravo:)
title: 5+*****stars!  Beautiful resort

text:
Santi Sari is a freshly built beautiful boutique hotel, the build is of a high quality with attention to detail... focusing on creating a healing place. It is as private as you want it to be designed with great chill out areas and separate infinity pools and restaurants.

The staff are very friendly and the food is exceptional, there are some excellent day activities we went on the private boat and snorkled around Menjangan island, great to see some amazing fish and coral that has been untouched...

If you go to Bali Santa Sari is a must do, it would suit singles, couples and would be perfect for a group of friends...

My thanks to Tony for helping out a sick traveler, this really is a healing place recommended to all, staying there really was a memorable part of my holiday :)
title: A beautiful place to relax and unwind

text: "What a beautiful place! I arrived at night and woke up to the most breathtaking views in every direction. The gourmet food was delicious, the rooms incredibly luxurious and their special massage treatment was fabulous. The icing on the cake for me was the private beach with a jetty and boat which took me to the nearby Menjangan Island to snorkel, have a picnic lunch and chill out. I can't recommend this place enough as it is in a class of its own and I am dreaming of my return visit."
title: The most beautiful and relaxing place I've ever visited!

text: The most lovely place to relax & enjoy the beautiful lovina area, along with the fantastic landscaping & vegetation, the amenities, staff and vibe are just amazing, a truly magical location and property
title: Santi Sari Serene Elegant & Gracious

text:
We drove around looking for a suitable place to stay in the area and it became oblivious after a couple of hours of looking at places that Santi Sari, compared to all else we saw, came out in front by far in value for what it offered. So we booked to stay for 3 nights, but after 2 nights decided to stay till our flight. Ten days of bliss. I had no idea, there was so many levels of relaxation.

We went on Santi Sari's snorkelling tour twice. Could have gone everyday, and on hindsight wish we had gone a couple more times. 

Quite honestly we would probably have left Bali early if was not for Santi Sari. I just cannot recommend them highly enough. And would agree with everything said by the previous reviewer. 

There is wifi in the restaurant area, not in the rooms...but why would you want to remain in the rooms even if they were divine, when salt water pools and gardens are heaven itself. Don't hesitate! Experience Santi Sari yourself!
title: 10 days of bliss

text:
A lovely boutique hotel. Very warm welcome by the owner Tony who was very helpful throughout the whole stay.

We were there 3 nights and took 2 day-trips to Menjangan islands for snorkeling. It was a wonderful experience. You need a boat and a guide to get there. Nana, the guide from the hotel, was great. Highly recommended to take that trip.

Food was of good quality, some dishes like pasta and desserts excellent. The pizza was a bit sweet and reminded me of pizzas in UK, not Italy ;-) Anyhow, we were happy to get also European food as we ate just local Indonesian food the weeks before. There are a lot of vegeterian options which is great.

The only negative point we have is not really a big issue: the indonesian staff was very friendly but seemed partly over professional. For example ordering an espresso instead of Bali coffee at breakfast shouldn't be a big thing and of course also not charged extra. But due to their professionalism they did not really know how to solve that and finally refused. Well, again, not due to unwillingness - more due to beeing trained very straight. The warmths and true hospitality we felt from Tony was not coming from the staff.

We had several such smaller issues where we had the same feeling. Anyhow, the overall experience was great and we would stay here again definitly.

Massage was good and affordable.

Wifi works well in the restaurant area and that is completely fine. For north Bali that is a high standard - we stayed in other areas where we had way more troubles to connect.

You get used to the prayers of the Mosques. As Bali is an Indonesian island it just is, how it is. A/C was the best we had on our trip, in quite mode still powerful enough to cool our room. We had the smallest room I guess and can of course just talk for our room.

It is a remote, peaceful and quite place. Highly recommended if you plan snorekling in Menjangan islands.
title: Great place for relaxing and snorkeling

text:
We enjoyed a few fantastic relaxing days and the owners Carol and Tony made us feel very welcome and at home. We succeeded in our goals to do nothing at all and did not leave the boutique resort safe for a snorkeling trip at the colourful reef.  The staff is super firendly and engaging, the food wonderful - try the fresh sambal matah with each dish - and the remaining stock of Storm beer goes very well with the food - or with peanuts during late afternoon lounging at the salt water pools. 
The rooms were clean and well designed and thought through, probably the result of the couples extensive traveling in the past :) 

One of the highlights was a birthday celebration at the balcony of the massage floor surrounded by flowers and candlelights which came as a total surprise: Tony and Carol offered a glass of champaign, the staff lit sparkler fireworks, the birthday cake was presented by the staff and shared, and on return in the bungalow a beautiful flower arrangement with frangipani flowes and little organge flowers painstakingly pinned to a well wishes card was on the four poster bed. An unforgettable experience. 

Definitely a place recommending for a few days romantic getwaway!
title: Wonderful stay

text:
For general comments see other reviews.

Pros :
-nice isolated place to rest peacefully in a beautiful setting
-very personalised service and attention by Tony the owner (& wife to some degree) 

Neutral :

- food : some good (pasta) to less good (local dish a bit tasteless). Very surprising : had complete scampi (with carapace !) pan fried. When enquired, was told its always like this and word should be given to the cook to change habit (after 5 years of existence ??).

Cons :
- bungalows in a beautiful garden but too close to each other : need to keep some curtain close all the time for privacy. And that is really a pity as there is enough land to provide more space and better independence feeling.

-airco : too weak

- no internet in the room, reason given for health (dont understand why option not given and simply switch off if not needed, like in the main restaurant building)

-rooms : nice big beds but.. due ramadan and Mosque nearby, was woken up every morning around 4am, despite earplugs provided.

Conclusion : its overall a nice place, which gives feeling of being away from the crowd. But when charged these kind of price for north Bali, you expect a bit more "professionalism", not to say more "value for money".
title: Aiming a bit high ?

text:
'Santi Sari' translates to english as 'essence of peace' the owners Tony and Carole explained to us during our stay- and it's easy to see why. In a similar vain to all other reviews on here, I must celebrate the attention to detail in all areas of this magnificent boutique hotel. The super friendly and attentive staff are always at hand to fulfill your requests, whether it be to pick something up from the shop for you or even to give you a full body massage (with a choice of delicious smelling oils). Due to the welcoming and attentive nature of the staff it was incredibly easy to feel at peace and calm in the beautiful settings of the hotel. Home stresses and worries seemed to dissappear as soon as we arrived and set us up for the ultimate fortnight of relaxation, fantastic sea food and cultural activites. Tony arranged a driver for us to visit Ubud, Deer island for snorkling and several local temples in Permuteran. 

We experienced luxurious comfort in the Banyan suit and bathed mainly by the smaller pool- and due to the small number of rooms it is possible to recieve the upmost privacy at all times. It was also lovely to sit down for dinner with Tony and Carole and the other guests for dinner each night and hear stories and the history of the island. They are extremely knowledgable and enthusiastic about the vibrant culture in Bali.

i couldn't reccomend this hotel more. It is idyllic, tranquil, colourful and time seems to drift by with a sense of calm. 

Awesome for couples but equally as accomodating for groups travelling around the island or lone travellers looking for a rest-stop. whoever you are and wherever you're from, one things is certain, that Tony and Carole will be the most welcoming hosts you have ever met, and you wil leave santi sari feeling cleansed and calm :)

Thanks Tony and Carol for a wonderful stay
title: Truly serene

text:
I can only add to the number of five star reviews that have left by visitors past to Santi Sari; this is a truly special retreat and an unmissable experience for anybody wanting to venture away from the busy throngs and beaten paths of Kuta, Seminyak and Ubud in the South. 

Much of what I could say about the place has already been posted below, in particular, references to the magnificent choice of setting, the painstaking attention to detail in every hidden corner of the resort and the attentiveness and friendliness of every staff member on site, all of which left me feeling incredibly fulfilled and relaxed  by the end of my stay. I can only endorse the other positive comments, and remind the owners Carole and Tony that I will be back on my next stay to Bali to take full advantage of their wonderful hospitality.
title: A perfect stay

text:
Lots of  positive things have already  been said about Santi Sari in previous reviews. We can fully endorse them all.  Santi Sari really is a very special and spiritual place, unequalled in our years of travelling around the world. From the moment we arrived everything was done by the lovely owners and all the staff to make our 2 week stay a wonderful experience.  

The hotel is set in extensive peaceful grounds, beautifully planted, which extend to the mangrove fringed private bay. From the hotel's jetty  there are stunning views of the volcanoes on nearby Java,  and is the best place to catch sunrise and sunset.  It is located in a part of Bali that has minimal impact from tourism - a world away from the Southern part of the island. 

We were absolutely delighted with our suite, Banyan 4, but  would have been equally happy with any of the other suites, small or large.  All are spacious, beautifully furnished with high quality furniture and furnishings. The housekeeping is exemplary and the locally produced toiletries are luxurious. The air con is the best we've ever had. 

The menu is extensive and varied, with plenty of vegetarian options. The food is absolutely delicious, beautifully presented, in generous portions.  The local fish dishes are a must! As are the homemade ice creams and sorbets.  

The programme of excursions offered, with local drivers and guides, is imaginative and provides a real experience of Bali. The trips to Ijen volcano on Java, UNESCO rice fields at Jatiluwih,   and snorkelling at Menjangan island shouldn't be missed. Neither should the relaxing spa treatments. 

What really sets this place apart from others is the total sense of peace and tranquility, and it is a truly spiritual place that is very hard to leave.   

Just go there and experience it yourselves.
title: A truly wonderful place

text:
Our stay on Santi Sari was the last two weeks of January 2014 and what a great find. Can't speak highly enough of this resort and we are 5 star hoteliers. Your hosts are superb, the staff friendly and attentive, the food very good. Would like to point out we are seasoned travellers of the Maldive but one would have to snorkel/Dive here as it is superb.
This place is a must for anyone thinking of travelling to Bali.
title: BLISS

text:
We had an excellent time at Santi Sari for 5 days a few weeks ago. We had the resort almost entirely to ourselves which added to the feeling of total seclusion in North-western Bali, except for the calls for prayer in the morning which can be considered a bit annoying. In particular the ones that do not seem to come from actual mosques, but from neighboring houses. 
Nonetheless it has been a great experience: The food was fantastic, so was our experience with day-trips and the spa. In particular snorkeling around the Island Menganjan (Deer Island, where we saw 5 of the deer that give the Island is name during a short walk). Also the nature walk was a nice experience. Thank you, Santi Sari. 
Overall we consider this a must-go location in North-western Bali.
title: Great experience, property and staff

text:
Stayed here with a group of friends and loved it. It's a 4 hour drive from Denpasar, but the drive itself is stunning (and you can make stops along the way if you arrange it), and when we arrived at Santi Sari, it felt like we'd been dropped in paradise. The owners go out of their way to make you feel at home, and even took us around the area to see some of the temples and nearby turtle sanctuary. You could easily just hang out at the hotel and relax - breakfast and the restaurant are excellent, and the infinity pool is stunning - we couldn't stop taking photos. The rooms are beautiful and large, with mosquito netting over the beds (bring good repellent, though they also have some there) and a gorgeous outdoor shower in the garden. 

We did two additional excursions - renting a boat for the morning to go snorkelling at Pulau Menjangan (the owners recommended snorkeling so that we could be all together rather than diving, as some of us weren't certified, but if I were to go back, I'd definitely want to dive as well - the water and diversity of fish and coral is just incredible) - definitely the nicest place I've snorkelled. We also did the 1-day excursion to the neighbouring island of Java to hike up Kiawah Ijen volcano, see coffee plantations, visit a stunning waterfall, etc. - highly recommended, though you should be in decent shape for the hike. The volcano features a crater lake with the most incredible colours, and we agreed it was probably the highlight of our trip to Bali (despite being on Java).

The only slight unpleasantness came when we wanted to pay - we'd requested the bill in advance so that we could divide it up, but we didn't receive it until our car to take us back to Seminyak had arrived. Only at this time did we learn that payment by credit card would tack on an additional fee, and if we didn't have local currency, the exchange rate used was unfavourable (despite prices being quoted to me in USD when I emailed to make the reservation). We hadn't expected this and at no point were we told that despite the reservation quote being in USD, we would have to pay in local currency. This definitely wouldn't prevent me from recommending Santi Sari and staying here again, but it's something to keep in mind.
title: Beautiful boutique hotel in a less-travelled part of Bali

text: Last November we had a wonderful stay in the Santi Sari Boutique Hotel. From day 1 ( the moment we stepped into the reception) to the last day all was perfect. Excellent hotel room/cabin. We had the one with an outside bath which we really used and enjoyed. Breakfast was a choice from the menu. We skipped lunch but were welcomed everyday with an afternoon tea with sandwiches. Dinner from the local cook was also excellent and more than enough for every apetite. There is a small wine list, but i am not a great fan of the local produced wines, but still a glass of wine to even more enjoy the evening on the terraces of Santi Sari was the reason for me to choose the wine they offered. Bedrooms and Beds are excellent, but because of a large muslim population in the nearby town, there is a call for morning prayer at 04.15 hrs which could wake you up. So when you are a light sleeper use the earplugs supplied by Santi Sari or bring your own. 2 Swimming pools are available, many of the rooms have outside beds. A large garden and a very nice view from the terraces, garden and 1st floor in the main building make it even more desirable place to stay. Staff is excellent and i can recommend the body massages and daytrips. If ever we will revisit Bali we will make sure that the Santi Sari will be on the list of our stops on this beautiful island with its friendly people. We can truly recommend the Santi Sari when you visit the region of Permuteran.
title: 7 days in Santi Sari was the ultimate relaxation

text:
Santi Sari is off the beaten path and somewhat of an enclave in the northwest corner of Bali, near the national park.  The property and rooms are lovely as already described by others. Owners are attentive and genuinely want your stay with them to be perfect; they are proud of the place and have worked hard to create an appealing, high-end destination with all the amenities. The staff is well-trained and warm. Half-board or full-board option covers all meals while you're there; other restaurant options really don't exist nearby.  

You will get a taste of Hindu/Balinese life if you are lucky enough to be there for a ceremony, make it a point to ask questions of the owners and staff, and/or are adventurous enough to walk into the village where you will probably turn some heads, as tourists are relatively rare in this area. 

Roads are slow in Bali and I wouldn't recommend using Santi Sari as a home base; instead, enjoy it for what it is: top notch snorkeling easily accessed with Santi Sari's boat and Nama as a guide; lovely pool; terraces to read and relax; terrific massage; and staff near at hand. What's not to like? We didn't venture off the property other than to snorkel, and probably should have, because I ended up feeling rather isolated and was glad to be going to Ubud for a few days. (As this was our first and probably only trip to Bali, we used Santi Sari for relaxation and rest, then enjoyed four nights in Ubud. While Ubud is criticized for being touristy, it offers Balinese crafts, traditional dancing, and a look at the rice paddies. A day trip into Ubud from Santi Sari would take six hours driving round-trip, and you would be there when it is loaded with other busloads of tourists from all over the island. There is much to enjoy in Ubud but not during those mid-day hours. For hotel recommendation there, see my other reviews.)
title: for upscale, slightly adventurous traveler; terrific snorkeling

text:
This hotel with only suites on offer has an aura of peace and tranquillity about it. It is set in grounds going all the way down to the sea, all 22 acers . The suite we had been allocated was beautiful with locally made furniture, a huge four poster bed and and a bathroom to die for. The bath was a volcanic boulder cut in half with the inside scooped and smoothed out with enough room for even a party in the bath.

Food was beautifully presented, delicious and fresh using local produce and localy caught fish.
Wine was well represented from all continents.

The staff were just simply brilliant always with huge smiles and willing. Could not have been better.

We were invited by the owner to the temple he had built for the staff to take part in a service celebrating the new moon. We were made to feel very comfortable and part of the whole proceedings. Another great experience.

If you go, you must try the snorkling on the reef off deer island. It is simply outstanding, the fish, the colours and of course the coral. This was then followed by lunch on the beach. Make sure Nana goes with you. He looks after the hotel's boat and he will ensure your absolute safety. Great guy.

Then there is the rain forrest trek. Just go and learn what nature does. We learned so much about the trees from the owner. And you are surrounded by monkeys who are so playful.   

Would we go again? Back next year, just working through some dates. It was chillin'.
title: Chilling out

text:
Going back to a place which was simply said more than perfect the first time is always tricky.

Tricky in the sense that the perfection, the sensation and magic of the place experienced during the first visit is always hard to surpass and a second visit can only end up being lower on the scale than the first encounter, especially if it was so very special back then. 
Going in against that feeling we went anyways back to Santi Sari, and how good that decision turned out to be! 
Again we came in the low season, meaning that is was very quiet, only one or two other guests, the staff relaxed and the weather still perfect.
Going to Santi Sari means: Tranquility, Spirituality, Rest, Relax, very good food, perfect service and amazing rooms. The combination of this all brings makes the difference to other comparable hotels, 1+1=3 applies here.
Our visit was again perfect and we enjoyed it so much. For us, it remains a special place and we hope to come back one day, hopefully with family or friends to share it with.
The boutique hotel has a 'feel' which is hard to find and to equal, but hard to make tangible in words. My advise would be to just go and experience.
As a last comment i would like to especially thank the whole Santi Sari team for making our visit unforgettable. You make the difference.
Thanks Carole and Tony for having us again, the fruit of your hard labor is evident. We will see each other again.
title: Can a sequel live up to the first one? => definitely at Santi Sari

photos.caption: The devil is in the detail, also perfect..
the main building from the jetty at sunset

text:
One of the most luxury hotel in Bali, Santi Sari is a seafront hotel, is a calm place, you can find peace to yourself in a comfortable suite, with private pool, private beach, amazing gardens, ultimately, exceptional, I have no words to describe. I been there in March 2012, me and my girlfriend, and we knew the owner, a men from England, very sympathetic, even went to diving with him. The food in the restaurant is very good, with fresh seafood and fresh fruits. So, there is amazing, we were in Australia when traveled there, and now I live in Brazil. My girlfriend loved everything as well and we really hope, one day, get back to Santi Sari. Sincerely, we got very very satisfied. 

Thanks
title: Luxury Hotel in the North of Bali

text:
It is a lovely place, a true retreat where you enjoy the naturalia simply relax. 
The surrounding and the location is too marvelous that you cannot miss. If you wish to look for quality service and exclusive hotel SantiSari is where you can rely; It fits all.
The staffs and service is friendly and helpful. A chill and again relax place for couple or alone.
title: A place you must not miss!

text:
Just came back from our vacation and can't wait to share with you for the days in Santi Sari.This is the best place we have ever stayed for vacation.An eight-hours flight from Shanghai and 4 hours on the way through the northern mountain area of Bali by car. And the final rough dirt road to Santi Sari leaded my sense of wonderful land would be there ..!!!! Wow!!!!!!
Very very nice and beautful spot,excellent bedding and room,food was very good with very good service and nice personels. And spa was excellent and it is a same or even better level than as in Maya Hotel ( top one spa in Ubud ). We have a half day for snorkeling with a good and experienced guy and a boat with driver exclusively. 
Also have had a walk in National Park along the beach with a interesting guide.
Have days in swimming pool and sun bathing in the morning share with lovely garden and surroundings.You can feel the real peace both in body and mind.
They have a small shop and collections for collectables with the owners view. Good designs and trends of Bali with top quality and perfectly reasonable prices. The pearls and conch shells displayed look like some luxury ones.
Things happen in Santi Sari these days was amazing+fantastic,.....far beyong my words.
People go to santi sari are prayed for peace and good!!!!! Carole,thank you!!!
title: amazing+fantastic+perfet+stunning+wonderful

photos.caption: with wonderful view from side gazebo

text: Traveling through Bali we ended our holidays at this gorgeous place. Beautifull spot, quiet, frendly personel, seaview, fantastic rooms, excelent food, 7 hectare private garden at sea, nice and interested hosts. Need I say more?
title: Fantastic

photos.caption: Drinking fresh coconut juice directly from the garden without using hands:-)

text:
This is by far the loveliest place I have ever stayed. I came here with my boyfriend, my mum and dad for five nights. Hidden away down a dirt track you would never guess that this place existed! We arrived at night after a long car journey and were made to feel very relaxed and welcome immediately.

The owners, Tony and Carole were both around for the whole time we were there and they did everything they could to make sure we were happy. They really went out of their way - as did the rest of the staff - to make the experience amazing.

The grounds are absolutely stunning and are immaculately kept. There are two pools although we just used one and mostly had it to ourselves for the whole trip (a stroke of luck since it's a busy place).  Lots of comfortable sunloungers and plenty of clean beach towels laid out so you could help yourself. They have literally thought of your every possible need! 

The rooms are faultless; beautifully decorated, spacious and immaculate. The bathroom is huge with a great shower. Lovely toiletries provided and we had aloe vera plants outside to use when sunburned! 

We ate three meals a day in the restaurant for the five days we were there and the food was always absolutely delicious. The chocolate mousse was one of my favourites! The restaurant staff were also incredibly accommodating and so friendly - they could not do enough to please you.

There is a good choice of activities to do if you fancy a break from sunbathing. I had an oil massage in a beautiful spacious room with an astonishing view which was amazing! We also went snorkeling for the day, something I would highly recommend. The man who took us on the trip was so friendly, helpful and kind. My mum was really nervous about getting in the water and he stayed by her side the whole time just so she could experience snorkeling. He brought everything we could have possible needed or wanted and more - we just had to turn up. 

The whole place is just so peaceful and relaxing - it was difficult adjusting to the other accommodation booked for the rest of our trip since Santi Sari set the standard so high! I simply cannot fault it and would highly highly recommend staying there to anyone.
title: Peaceful and stunning

text:
The trip advisor says that by sharing our review on Santi Sari others will make better judgments... we care so we will share....You can not go wrong...as simple as that. The previous reviews cover nearly everything that needs to be covered. 
The scenery and setting of the whole place and the instant feeling of peace and calm that transcends upon you as soon as you open the car door in front of the reception for the first time; the incredibly polite and friendly attitude of the staff who greet you by name as you approach them for the first time and all other times thereafter; the sounds, smells and views across the pool onto the mangroves and fishing boats afar in the sea; the incredible high quality of the food...the chocolate fondant is especially to die for, even for those who do not have a sweet tooth.
So many more adjectives can be used, all of them reflecting positively on Santi Sari and every aspect of hospitality.
We spent 9 nights here and as you would have guessed by now, we were pampered to death. The scenery, the people, the food, the atmosphere were divine.
We spent at least 3 days out and about visiting sights and other towns. 
The snorkelling is a must. The hotel will arrange everything for you with their own boat off their own jetty and even arrange for your picnic lunch by the temples.
The massages with the natural oils from the hotels' own aloe vera plants will relax muscles you did not know you had.
Most importantly of all, are the proprietors, Carole and Tony. One of them is always at Santi Sari but if you are fortunate enough, as we were to have them both there at the same time, then you have had double the experience of a lifetime. They make you feel as if Santi Sari is your home and that you have been friends for years....This is the icing on the cake and you will not get anything like it anywhere.....
title: Our little heaven on earth

text:
We had our wedding on Menjangen Island and stayed at this resort as part of the wedding package and we couldn't have picked a better place. This place is the closest thing to paradise that we have ever seen! Amazing scenery, layout, and staff.  The room was luxurious with fine wood carving everywhere and day beds for relaxing. The rooms were so nice, we almost didn't  want to go outside.  The grounds were so nice, we almost didn't want to go to our room... Quite the struggle we had :). Everything we had at the restaurant was also very rich in flavor and we always ended our meals with a smile. We also enjoyed our time with Tony and Carol who helped us out with absolutely everything we needed. Thank you Tony and Carol for building this place and making our time there something we will never forget. We'll be back!
Ps. The pictures do not do justice for how beautiful this place is!
Megan and Tyler
title: Wedding was amazing!

text: a hidden gem in a very small village of Goris, Pejarakan, of north west coast of Bali. when i was driving down the village, it did not leave me a good impression until i found out, that i was completely wrong. Surrounded by a lush green mangrove area with a stunning view of a fishermen village in a distance, this resort is just simply unforgettable, We sampled various appetizers from the simple yet chique menu card. We had Tabouleh Salad, Greek salad, Mini spring rolls to name but a few and every single dish was just exceptional. We met with the ever hospitable owners Carol and Tony from UK, and they let us try the samosas too as it wasnt on the menu card yet. again, this is also a simple but yet delicious starter. a perfect place to relax after your snorkeling adventure at Menjangan Island. Highly recommendable
title: Unforgettable

photos.caption: the common room above the restauranr
the fish pond at the other side of the restaurant

text:
Though I've reviewed Santi Sari after our visit last year, I wanted to write a second review simply to drive home the point that this place is heavenly. Located off the beaten path in the peaceful and quiet northwestern Bali, Santi Sari is truly a boutique property. 

With only a handful of rooms, but with a staff of 50, the service is second to none. No request is too small or too large. Meals can be served anywhere (in the restaurant, the rooms, and even the shaded bures which are situated next to the main pool (a smaller pool is located in the second complex of villas).

This trip, we brought our kids here; however, this isn't a destination for children. My wife and I had made good friends with Carol, one of the owners, and when we found ourselves visiting Bali again this year with our kids, they were just as excited to visit and meet her.  This year, joining her, is the resort's other owner, Tony. Both are extremely charming, sincere and really care about the guests.

Unfortunately, my wife and daughter were sick for most of our six night stay. We wanted to visit the volcanos of Java, and trek the national park, but the girls were really only well enough for a visit to Menjangan Island and fantastic snorkeling (a must see!). 

The massage offered is absolutely fantastic. Lasting two hours, I completely fell asleep as the cool trade winds blew past me (the service is done on the second floor above the kitchen, open to the breezes). This is extremely affordable, and well worth the time.

Rooms are fantastic, with the top floors offering great views out over the bay to the northeast.

We love the staff, almost all of whom were the same as from last year's visit. They all called us by our first name (which I prefer to Mr. XXX), and we looked forward to seeing them everyday.

As with last year, we visited during Ramadan, and given the higher density of Muslims in this part of Bali (due to the close proximity to Muslim Java), there are a number of nearby mosques, which, using loudspeakers and pre-recordings, serve as the muezzin to the daily prayers. However, the speakers also blare at 4am (in order to awake the faithful up to give them time to eat before the sunrises and fasting begins). Frankly, I found the constant Arabic (yes, not Indonesian or Balinese) coming from the mosques to be exotic, and really added to the environment.

My review is but one of dozens, all of which (with the exception of one) are rated at 5 stars. I'm hoping that the fact that we chose to return will encourage you to choose this wonderful property.
title: So Good, We Came Back

photos.caption: Where I spent most of my days lazing away
Playing chess during the lazy days

text:
We spent 2 nights at Santi Sari and I can confirm that all the previous great reviews are true. It really IS a slice of heaven. Santi Sari sets the bar so high that any other place will have a hard time matching it. This is why I would  recommend to stay there towards the end of your trip :)
Thank you very much to Carole and Tony who are the perfect hosts and really know what they are doing. They took care of us in a way that made us feel at home from the minute we arrived.
We will be back!!
title: Heaven

text:
I love this place.... I really like the food, the pool/s, the rooms, the staff and did i say the Food...
it has a great location.... staff and owners terrific.  i have brought friends and they love it too..
title: wonderful!

text:
This place is just amazing. I could use all manner of superlatives to describe it but you can just check out the other reviews for that. I had done so, and so my expectations were very high when we arrived - I thought, there's no way this place can be as good as the reviews say. I'm happy to say I was completely wrong. While we weren't on our honeymoon, many of the other guests were and I would say it is very romantic so would be ideal for that.

It's completely stunning for a start, and the service is lovely. Everyone is so friendly. Special thanks to Tony who went completely out of his way to show us around the local area (Ed will never forget the turtle sanctuary!). To be honest you don't need to leave Santi Sari; it's so peaceful. The salt water pools are incredible, the suites are secluded, luxurious and clean. The food is epic (big thanks to the talented chef) - 5 nights and we didn't get through the whole menu so we'll have to come back for that reason alone. I also recommend the snorkelling trip and the full balinese massage.

It's fair to say there is one thing that may be a downside for some; it's a long drive from the airport (about 4 hours), but actually we found that made it all the more special and the drive itself is pretty gorgeous - so for us it wasn't a downside at all. I would recommend letting the Santi Sari team arrange this for you though - the local taxi drivers may struggle to find it as it's well off the beaten tourist track. Some people mention the call to prayer - I suppose this could be annoying in the first day or two, but everything is so relaxing that it all adds to the charm, and we were sleeping through it by night 3 anyway (and I am a very light sleeper). Tony and Carole have extensively researched the best earplugs in the world anyway so you don't need to worry.

I can't wait to go back and would emphatically recommend a stay here to anyone heading to Bali. Or to anyone who wants pure luxury, peace, service, relaxation - it really is a dream.

Thank you Tony and the whole team. Jen and Ed x
title: You'd struggle to get better

text:
My Wife and I spent 3 days at Santi Sari for our honeymoon on our trip to Bali. I now regret that I didn't book 6 or more nights as we had the most incredible time!
Santi Sari is beyond a dream, it's beyond perfection, it's in a class of it's own.
From the moment of arrival you are taken into a dream land of smiling faces, palatial rooms, mesmerizing views, exquisite food and ultimate relaxation. 
We had to pinch ourselves every morning to make sure that it was all real and not some illusion..
If a 4hr drive sounds too far to get to Santi Sari, just know that it's worth it. You can even break it up and stay somewhere half way - the drive itself it very interesting, passing beautiful temples, padi fields, volcanoes and quaint villages. And if you are feeling tired when you get there, just sign yourselves up for one of their traditional Balinese Massages - it's one of the best massages we ever had, and VERY affordable.
I'm not going to write down every little secret of this place as you have to come here and experience it yourself, a trip to Bali isn't complete without visiting Santi Sari.
Tony and Carole and all the wonderful staff at Santi Sari, Thank You for making our honeymoon magical!
title: Incredible!!

text: From the moment I arrived I was treated like a queen. No request too big. The ambience and decor are tasteful and make for an authentic Bali experience. The meals in the restaurant were scrumptious and I was very impressed when we were offered very fresh catch of the day straight off the local fishing boat. The massage treatments were amazing and also very reasonable. The private boat trip from the hotel jetty to snorkel at Menjangen Island was absolutely brilliant, I am a diver and was very impressed, the corals here are world class. The owners go out of their way to make you feel welcome. I will definitely be returning to this hidden gem.
title: Flawless

text: Had a lovely time with my partner at Santi Sari. Set in gorgeous surroundings! Away from all the tourists of Bali, of which they are many. Worthy of note is the hotels food, which was fabulous. Much better than the food in Four Seasons Bali at Sayan. Carole the owner is also lovely, made us feel very welcome.
title: Beautiful place!

text:
We have just returned from a fabulous week at Santi Sari.  Travelling to Bali on the strength of previous reviews of this hotel expecting to find something negative to tell you. Our mission failed - it IS perfect!!  We feel we have experienced the real Bali rather than the commercial strip of the south and the journey from the airport to Santi Sari gave the opportunity to visit the mountainous centre of the island.  
Welcomed with a blessing and a personal tour of the hotel by the owner, Carole, it was a dream holiday from start to finish.
Pampered by the Balinese staff, who are all delightful, we enjoyed the manicured gardens, lovely pools, and great food.  Tony, the joint owner, accompanied us snorkelling as he sensed our 'first timer' nervousness. Visiting the reef was a trip of a life time ending with lunch on a deserted sandy beach. 
Much has been made in previous reviews about the morning call to prayer when we felt it only added to a unique and magical atmosphere.
Our thanks to Tony and Carole for making us feel like personal guests in thier little paradise.
title: Perfect.....Perfect......Perfect

text: We returned from Bali a few days ago and Santi Sari was our favorite place on the island, and one of the best hotels in the world we've ever stayed at. Carole, the owner, arranged for an excellent driver to pick us up on the other side of Bali and deliver us through the mountains to her little paradise. The hotel is in a non-tourist area, and it is integrated with the local ecology and culture. You don't just get a resort experience, but a unique look into the real Bali. Santi Sari is elegant, relaxed, and appears effortless, although it must take an unbelievable amount of work to keep it so perfect. The food was phenomenal and the staff was very flexible in catering to individual needs. Carole and the staff genuinely cared about every element of our stay, and made each day memorable. We snorkeled around an uninhabited island, saw local Balinese dance, were massaged into putty, and toured the rainforest and mangroves with an expert who grew up in the protected park land. The only thing that could make it better was a longer time to stay. We will be back.
title: serenity defined

text:
We LOVED our experience at Santi Sari and would highly recommend to those wanting a magical and relaxing experience! The resort has an incredible "feel", is extremely tranquil, and the staff is gorgeous. We arrived to the welcoming arms of Carol, and soon after, enjoyed a fantastic massage, all while gazing over the mangrove trees and watching the clouds turn pink as the sun set. 

Our day trip to Menjangan was hosted by Nana, who is a beautiful soul and lovely man. We saw incredible corals. The fish were bountiful and every color of the rainbow!

We really enjoyed our time at this special retreat and will be heading back soon/already telling our Bali friends. 

Come prepared to be pampered and amazed by everything :)
title: The best spot in Bali

text: Arriving in the village of the Santi Sari, you wonder what you will find ? But when you arrive at the entrance, you discover a beautiful little gem: manicured gardens, lovely reception area, beautiful restaurant in front of the main pool, fantastic rooms and all this complemented with extremely friendly and helpful staff. Bring all these elements together, and you have a beautiful boutique hotel to enjoy the beautiful north west area of Bali. A special thanks to Tony, who helped our stay to be a superb memory!
title: Hidden gem

text:
We wanted a very relaxing holiday after a busy week in Hong Kong and booked the Santi Sari after reading all the reviews. 
Carole, one of the owners, advised us to take half board and she chose a perfect suite for us to stay in. She arranged for a driver to pick us up from the airport with bottles of water and iced towels, sandwiches to be waiting for us in our room since we didn't arrive until 12.30 at night and all the arrangements worked perfectly. 
Santi Sari must be the one of the most peaceful places we have visited. It is immediately calming but full of interest. Tony, the other owner was our host while we stayed (it felt like we were staying with a friend) and he showed us plants and herbs that are growing in the extensive grounds while answering our questions about local culture and tradition.
We did several of the activities that others have recommended and they are as good as everyone says - snorkelling at Deer Island, visiting the turtle sanctuary, visiting temples and the Rice fields - the Luwak pooh coffee at the coffee plantation was interesting but we left it untasted! The massages are a must.  
Just staying near the pools, reading and swimming - breathing in the scents from the flowers was often enough for us.
The rooms were stunning, food was good - we definitely recommend the half board option - more than we could eat sometimes - the cream and jam scones at tea time were particularly memorable. The staff were wonderful - so friendly and helpful - nothing was too much trouble.

As someone else said, "very very happy"

We'd love to return there.
title: It really is as excellent as the reviews say.

text:
Santi Sari is about 4 hours or more from the airport in the South.  Arrived tired around dinner time but the staff and Tony, one of the British owners were waiting to welcome me. They had a blessing ceremony, which was nice I suppose but would have liked to have been asked as I am Christian.  I went along with it in the spirit of respecting the culture of others especially in their country but it was weird for me.  Santi Sari has more of a jungle setting than a beach setting.  There really is no beach to swim or lounge in but there are some good views of the Bali sea beyond the jungle and the grounds are well kept.  If you desperately want the beach, this location is not for you.  If you are looking  to get away from it all and I do mean get away from it ALL,  you will love Santi Sari.  It is quite remotely located.  As most Balinese practice Hinduism, the owners have built this place with the Hindu religion in mind.  There is a temple on the grounds where the staff and guests (if interested) can participate in blessings and ceremonies.  The highlight of my stay was the day of snorkeling at the spectacular coral reefs on Menjangan island.  Santi Sari has a private boat and offer a packed lunch.  Tony went with us and was like a personal guide for the day.  They really do give you a personal experience.  You don't have to be an expert to snorkel here but they had someone with me as it was my first time.  You should come to Santi Sari just for the snorkeling and diving.

Pros of Santi Sari - Owner/manager, Tony Pinkus tries his very best to accommodate your needs.  Staff are very attentive but English is a challenge so don't get frustrated trying to explain what you need.  Food choices are decent for a 5 day stay but not beyond.   If you are vegetarian, there is plenty to choose from. Highly recommend the chocolate fondant and the Risotto.  Rooms are simply decorated but clean and spacious.  I recommend the massage.  Had two during my three day stay.  half board option for food is also a great option though you can order a la carte too.

Cons of Santi Sari -  Had to request things that should be standard in a hotel like this e.g., internet service in the rooms if they have internet at all.  No nightstand space beside the bed so you have to put your stuff on the floor.   My biggest Con.  I did not sleep well for all three nights I was there.  Air conditioning in the room was not powerful enough for such a large room and it had some sort of setting that they were not able to fix.  My bathroom was not air conditioned so you are pouring with sweat before you are even dressed.  Pillows were uncomfortable and I had a crane in my neck daily.  Massages helped though.  At 5am on the dot, the very loud muslim call to prayer is guaranteed to wake you up despite the ear plugs.

Overall, I will return here as an excellent place to stay to go diving but not as a destination in itself - only because of the logistics of getting there.
title: Serene and Peaceful

text:
We recently returned from a 7 night stay at the Santi Sari where we had the most fabulous holiday. The quality of the accommodation, the setting, and the service was  superb. We stayed in a master suite and had the half board option, which proved ideal and in reality was more like full board especially as it includes afternoon tea. The suite with its pretty terraces and lovely furnishing was heavenly.  The owners, Tony and Carole, were wonderful hosts, and could not have been more welcoming, and extremely helpful and informative throughout the whole of our stay. The staff were lovely, always attentive and were both professional and friendly. The menu is extensive with both Balinese and European dishes, all beautifully cooked by the wonderful chef. We highly recommend the snorkelling and Deer Island trip, even though one of us didn't venture too far from the boat we saw lots of beautiful fish thanks to Nana and Gede.
