The Balinese massages were delightful and made a relaxing stay even more relaxing. The saltwater swimming pools are fabulous, and the tranquil and beautifully designed gardens and lotus pools were hard to leave. We look forward to when we can return.
title: An amazing place that more than lives up to its ratings.

text:
Had a very short 5 night stay at this delightful resort.
It ticked all the boxes. Great grounds, great rooms, great bathrooms, great pools, great food, great staff.
We did 2 excursions- the mangrove walk and the Menjangan Island snorkelling/picnic- very, very happy. The island trip is up there in my travelling highlights list.
Indulged in 2 massages, very enjoyable.
Hope to go back in the dry season- there is still much to do!!!
title: A haven in West Bali

text:
What a wonderful place to relax.  We were in Bali and looking for a hotel in the NW, close enough to snorkel Menjangan Island. We booked Santi Sari based on the fact that all the reviews were "Excellent".  We booked for 5 nights and it was hard to leave after we had stayed 7 nights.  Our host, Tony, was like a friend by the end of the week and the staff was always wonderful - attentive and helpful.  As the previous reviewer says it has a good energy about it.  
The rooms are beautiful and well planned and the salt water pools are  soothing.  The menu at the restaurant is extensive and everything we tried was delicious.        
Spectacular snorkeling on Menanjen Island is only a 30 minute boat ride.  A trek in the national park is just a few minutes away.  Java is also very close and we kept thinking of going on the ferry but it was hard to leave our little "oasis".   Highly recommend a stay at Santi Sari.  
Thanks for a wonderful stay.
title: Hard to Leave

text: After a spectacular drive from Ubud over mountain ranges and through picturesque villages we reached Santi Sari and we knew we had entered a property that had a 'good energy' about it. From the moment we parked we knew we were in good hands, and the service provided by the staff was perfect from start to finish, under the attentive and graceful eye of Tony who took excellent care of us. The rooms were beautifully appointed and maintained, the grounds expansive, salt water pools were perfect, and the food was fantastic. The menu would have kept us interested for over a week with such a variety of dishes including fresh fish that can be selected from the hotel's private pier as the fishing boats come in. We will definitely be back, and next time hope to take advantage of the private boat for diving at Menjangan island. Thanks to Tony and all his wonderful staff, keep up the good work! This north western point of Bali is a must see for lovers of the island as it gives a fresh perspective to the better-known south, with plenty of nature and some of the best coral in the country.
title: Peaceful Paradise

text:
We asked Santi-Sari to organise our wedding ceremony. And we were happy we choosed with one! Everything  was just  perfect! 
Our ceremony was in small and beautiful unhabitated island by 30 min from S.S. by boat. It was ecceptional!!! I am not gonna desribe it, better look on the pictures.

Atmosphere was extremely friendly! The staff made us feel like special people in a very special place

The villa which we were leaving was breath-taking! The food was  fabulous! Massage very proffesional and with reasonable price.

It is hard to find a words to express our gratefullness to Santi-Sari and the owner Tony Pinkus. What they did it was amazing! 
We will always remember 3 days we spent there. And will definitely get back on our wedding anniversary.
title: Our wedding in Paradise :)

text: My friend and I stayed at Santi Sari for 3 nights to be close to Menjangan (deer) island and the West Bali national park. The hotel exceeded our expectations. The rooms were prepared to perfection. The staff are extremely friendly. The food is delicious, unique, and affordable. The massages were wonderful and very reasonably priced. The hotel offers a private boat ride to Menjangan Island for a day of snorkeling (highly recommended!). We also trekked the nearby national park. The trek guide, recommended by Santi Sari, was a neat person to talk to for 3 hours. Unfortunately there is no beach at the hotel, but they do offer free rides to a nearby beach. The salt water pool was another unique feature.
title: Beautiful and quaint

text:
More words: After traveling for hours I wondered what I had gotten us into as our driver drove down the muddy, rutted road that led to Santi Sari. Upon our arrival, our first impression was delight. The main lobby is situated in a stand-alone structure featuring antique Balinese teak furniture and clean, polished marble tile. Gede greeted us with incense and a prayer. He was gracious and warmly welcoming. 

Then the owners emerged to greet us with smiles and hugs, and then escorted us to the restaurant. They led us down a long patio path with a thatched roof. Butterflies were everywhere. I wondered where we were headed when suddenly a Buddist statue came into view. 

As we entered the main area of the resort, a gorgeous garden of peace, a lotus pond with elaborate bamboo and fresh flowers decorated for the the holidays. 

They greeted us with warm conversation and fresh watermelon juice, and told us our room had been upgraded. 

The room was breath-taking. A tall thatched roof, a private porch with an antique teak daybed and mosquito net for napping. Plantation chairs on the porch. The bed inside was like a cloud. The bathroom included a private double vanity area with two indoor-outdoor showers, a stone tub that retained the days solar energy. 

I could continue for hours about the room. 

The staff made us feel like special people in a very special place. We were present for Christmas Eve and Christmas Day. We enjoyed dinners with traditional live Balinese dancers, fireworks and delicious gourmet food. The other guests were also pleasant. An international group of like-minded travelers. Two groups of honeymooners. 

If I stay here again I will spend much of my time relaxing at the resort. It is "the perfect place to be stuck in Bali." 

Book all of the resort excursions. The site is well organized, and they will keep you safe. 

The resort had security and is walled all around. I felt exceedingly safe the entire time of our visit. And I miss it. I will always miss Santi Sari. But I have memories and the resort is by far--my unsurpassed resort stay experience in my lifetime.
title: One word: Spectacular

photos.caption: Lotus pond in main entrance to resort

text: We spent three nights in Santi Sari in May 2012. Looking back, this has been the best, most relaxing, friendliest and most tasteful hotel we have stayed at ever. Tony has been a lovely host, taking care about everything and ensuring that we had a very personal, familiar stay. We went for the snorkeling trip near the island in the national park and enjoyed the very relaxing massages. The pools are wonderful, and the rooms are very stylishly decorated. This place really makes a different compared to the mass market hotels. It is a individual choice. We have lots of good memories about it.
title: We found a peaceful paradise here

text: ...and it only gets better from there on out!  As you are led from the reception area where a short greeting ritual is performed, you enter the grounds and this first inkling of having arrived someplace special is only topped by the arrival at the lotus pond, afterwhich the open-air restaurant and infinity pool greet you with a view of the sea beyond.  Although my husband and I only had three days to spend at this lovely location, the relaxation we experienced made us feel as if we had spent double the amount of time.  The staff was very attentive, polite, yet personal, and Tony, the owner, was just a joy to speak with... and even accompanied us on one of the most spectacular days of snorkeling we have ever experienced.  Although we stayed in the Lotus 2 Suite, I think I could have been happy in any of the beautiful, well-appointed rooms.  I can definitely recommend this hotel and hope that we can come again.
title: An aura of peace and tranquility envelopes you upon arrival...

text:
My husband and I stayed here to celebrate our wedding anniversary and we could not have chosen a better place to spend our last week. From the moment we were picked up from our previous hotel( Munduk Moding) we knew we were going to be in heaven.
I booked direct with Carole and she was so helpful, answering all my questions, sadly we didn't meet her but were welcomed by Tony who also was the most charming man you could meet.
We stayed in Banyan 4 and loved the peace and tranquility, we didn't mind the local mosque or the noise of the animals as this just added to the charm of this boutique hotel.
On Carole and Tonys recommendation we went half board, so we dined superbly every day, breakfast was a treat and then we chose a starter for lunch and then had the remaining two courses for our evening meal, we even had scones, cream and homemade strawberry jam & tea at 4 pm so you can see we didn't starve. I was quite surprised that my clothes fitted by the end of the week, but I must admit they were getting very tight.
Both my husband and I had two massages which were amazing ,you are given a ginger or lemongrass & ginger tea afterwards which was much nicer than drinking water and you sit on the balcony watching the sunset- magical.
Tony took us to the local market and to view some very special temples but our most favourite trip was to go snorkelling to menjangan island. 
My husband is a very nervous swimmer but he was looked after by Nana, who took his hand and looked after him on both snorkelling trips, my husband said it is one of the best things he has ever done. Tony took the rest of us and pointed out all the local fish/ coral and even took his underwater camera so we have photos to prove what a wonderful setting it was. We ate our packed lunch near one of the piers overlooking the volcanoes of Java and then went for a walk along the beach before heading out snorkelling again.
This is truly a very special place to spend your holidays and we will recommend it to all our friends, you cannot over emphasise how friendly everyone is and Tony was on hand night and day if there were any problems. The couple we went snorkelling with left at 3 am to fly back to the UK and Tony even got up to say goodbye, this goes beyond the call of duty and shows how much he looks after his guests.
Would we go back, yes without a doubt, just start having to save up the pennies.
title: Heaven on earth, didn't want to leave this part of paradise

photos.caption: One of the many starters, such large portions
Coconut trees, they would always offer you one
Our massive bath and outside shower

text:
My husband and I arrived at Santi Sari 2 months ago today in the late afternoon of July 20, 2012 for 5 nights & 6 days to celebrate my birthday and our anniversary the following day.  So, we are very late in sending our review of the most spectacular place we have ever traveled. For 63 days now we have had the enjoyment of reminiscing on the most perfect vacation choice thus far.

The proprietor of Santi Sari, Carole Gregory Pinkus, was the most generous and hospitable human being we have ever met.  After traveling 5+ hours to Santi Sari, Carole met us as we entered the property with a beautiful smile and such graciousness that I knew we had entered a very peaceful and sacred place.  We were completely mesmerized by the extraordinary setting in all directions and found it difficult to say very much at first because the views of Santi Sari were so spectacular.  What awaits you as you walk across the lotus pond to the open restaurant is another breathtaking view.....the Bali Sea.  

The staff greeted us with their engaging smiles & charm and presented us with a Bali welcoming drink.  At last, we were able to relax by the pool and feast our eyes on the stunning views and architecture of Santi Sari.  After visiting with Carole and the staff for at least an hour we then walked to our Villa.  Every step we took greeted us with more breathtaking views.  Sometimes words cannot express such beauty and when this happens, it's nice to simply close your eyes...smile and be grateful.

My first sunrise at Santi Sari was on my birthday.  What beauty!  On occasion, you get to experience perfection and this was certainly that occasion.  My birthday & anniversary was celebrated with so much thoughtfulness by Carole and all her staff. She arranged a beautiful chocolate cake, singing by the staff and fireworks for both evenings.  A total surprise.  It was my first time to experience such a dramatic star lit sky and it lasted for 5 evenings.  I will never forget it!

I was delighted to read Seattle Eric..."Off The Beaten Path...." review.  Hi Eric and Leslie. We were at Santi Sari at the same time and enjoyed snorkeling with them on the day of our anniversary.  He gives a wonderful detailed description of Santi Sari regarding the staff, the property, the sight seeing, Menjangan (Deer) Island, snorkeling....everything.  So, I will simply say....DITTO.

I will not repeat what the brochure describes about the property.  It is all TRUE.  Also, the excellent ratings shared by all are indeed accurate.  I too, found it amazing that when searching this property, every comment was EXCELLENT.  That never happens but it is very clear to see why Santi Sari has this reputation.

I imagine that Carole prioritizes every guests, making them feel so very special while in her care at Santi Sari.  We discovered so many similar interests about life in general that it was a pleasure spending time in conversation with her, making our stay that much more enjoyable.  All of her staff reflect her charm and professional attention to every detail.

Carole, thank you for your unique vision and the opportunity to experience all that you, your entire staff and the peaceful surroundings of Santi Sari blessed us with during our vacation.
For those of you who have not yet traveled to Bali, make this your first stop!
title: "Paradise Found"

text:
A five star environment and service in a "home away from home" hospitality.

Warm hospitality, professional trained personnell, great attention to service. 

We highly appreciated the evening room preparation with antimosquitos coils (something that normally we have to do ourselves since even the smallest mosquitos hurts seriously) 

The food is great: very pleasent the selection of local dishes and mediterranean, healthy food.

Excellent the days on the boat to the national park

Great the view from the SPA while taking a nice massage after a day on the boat.
title: UNDERSTATED ELEGANCE

text: We have just recently returned after a fantastic trip to Bali the highlight of which was undoubtedly our week's stay in Santi Sari. From the moment we arrived we knew we were in for a treat. The property is absolutely stunning from the natural setting overlooking the sea to the beautiful grounds and rooms. We stayed in Banyan No.1 which came complete with huge bed, satellite tv, indoor and outdoor shower, massive outdoor bath and our own fishpond! The gardens and two pools are just beautiful, there are so many spots to relax from the restaurant to the sun loungers and day beds scattered throughout, so many statues, more fishponds and views to admire and all in the most peaceful setting imaginable. Carole, the co-owner, was there throughout our stay and could not have done any more to make us feel more welcome, we miss you Carole! A special mention to the staff, all staff, who were so genuinely warm and friendly and hello to Kama who encouraged us to step outside the grounds even though he knew we were having too good a time lolling around our private garden! The food is fabulous in the restaurant, the fresh fruit and yoghurt delicious at breakfast, we had so many dinners we worked our way through the menu, for me the best part was the chocolate fondant, I wanted to run away to lick the plate, divine! We actually did leave one day but by boat to visit the nearby island where we went snorkelling (my first time and all my nerves quelled by the nicest guide), spotted the local deer and had a great day out. Definitely worth the trip. We also took advantage of the massages on offer, and just generally had an amazing time sunbathing, swimming, relaxing and eating! This is undoubtedly the place to go if you want to chill out in the most beautiful surroundings imaginable and feel like you are in your own little corner of paradise – don’t hesitate, go as soon as you can! We will be back…
title: Balinese Paradise!

text:
My wife Leslie and I found Santi Sari on Trip Advisor, and were honestly surprised that every single review was given 5 stars; how is this possible? What spell is cast upon guests upon arrival? We decided to discover the truth for ourselves.

To get to Santi Sari, we took a 3.5 hour drive from Ubud. The first hour is all about traffic. Our driver jockeyed for space on the road with the omnipresent swarm of countless scooters. As we rose into the beautful interior mountains, the hubub of southern Bali slipped away. 

We were met upon arrival by the owner/proprietor, a lovely british woman named Carole, who became very dear to us over the course of our stay. She created the Santi Sari originally with the intention of it being her private residence; but during construction, she changed up her plans, adding a second story in both structures (there's a main structure with 4 accommodations, and a guest house with 6 accommodations).

We stayed in one of the owner's suites (Carole lived in the other one). One of the few differences between this category of accommodation and others is the addition of a second bedroom (which we didn't use, since there was just the two of us).

The hotel is built aligned east to west, taking full advantage of the vector of the trade winds, which blew through our room as well as the public areas all day long. Sunrises are exquisite, an explosion of light rising from the Bali Sea, visible from our bed. Sunsets are also beautiful, with only a walk to Santi Sari's private dock will reveal the sun setting behind the 6000+ feet of three Java volcanos.

The service is the best we've experienced in Bali - and that's saying a lot as this is our third trip to Bali, and we've stayed at six different properties over those trips. The restaurant staff, the housekeepers - all were so extraordinarily warm - they came to feel like family, and it was sad to have to say goodbye.

For a small boutique hotel in the middle of the proverbial nowhere, the food is fantastic. A huge menu that includes western favories as well as indonesian favorites (including Mie Goreng - a Balinese noodle dish that is to die for). Be prepared to pay through the tooth for alcohol, but this is an Indonesian 400% tax on booze problem, nothing that Santi Sari can do about it.

We stayed 4 nights, 3 days - 2 of which were spent at Menjangen (deer) island, a small island located about an hour's boat ride from Santi Sari's dock via twin engine boat. I went on a two tank dive one of the days, and snorkeling on the second. My wife snorkeled both days. The sealife was amazing - sea stars the blue of dusk sky, clown fish dancing around the protection of undulating coral - all was amazing.

We also visited the island's various temples, and even saw one of the deer for which the island is named. The whole experience was fantasic - if the skies are clear, the reward is a breathtaking view of Java's towering volcanos just across the straight of Bali. 

The property is fantastic - we spent one of our days just lounging around the pool and enjoying the atmosphere of the location. Need coffee, a drink while hanging out in your room? Just dial 116 and the restaurant will send up whatever you'd like.

For our final evening, Carole arranged a troupe of balinese dancers (all younger than 15), as well as some fireworks in honor of the wedding anniversary of one of the couples staying at the hotel.

Oh yes, then there are the call to prayers. We were at Santi Sari just as Ramadan began. There are a number of mosques in this part of Bali, which makes sense given the close proximity with Java. Most of Bali is Hindu, however, most of Indonesia is Muslim. In this part of Bali Muslims are more prevalent.

The worst time is the 4:30 noise - er, call to prayer. Blaring from 4+ different sources, the only hope is to be able to fall back asleep when it ends 45 minutes later. Apparently, during Ramadan, this call is to wake muslims so they can eat before the fasting begins at sunrise. Makes sense, but still annoying.

Don't let this little nuisance stop you from considering Santi Sari - it's a peaceful location, staffed by wonderful people who really care about you having the best service possible. There's always one of the owners there. Carole and Tony trade off every couple of months, spending their off time back in England.
title: Off the Beaten Path - Peace and Serenity in Northern Bali

photos.caption: Sunset looking to the East - view from owner's suite

text:
After a grueling, 26 hour journey from London, we were in a bit of a shambles when we arrived at Santi Sari to receive our welcome drink. However, even the jet lag didn’t prevent us from marveling at the palatial, botanical splendor of this remote resort. The attention to detail is impressive. Flowers blooming everywhere, shrines, sumptuous daybeds and lounge chairs scattered throughout the grounds, enormous four-poster bed—even the bathroom door had us oohing and aahing, never mind the boulder-hewn tub with the private fish pond out back. In fact, our (upgraded!) suite was so immediately lovely I began to feel a bit guilty as in: does anyone really deserve this level of understated, stylish luxury? What makes me so special? (Here the wife informs that my backpacker days are now, blessedly, well and truly behind me and that I need to get over myself.)

Santi Sari is quite a ways off the beaten track, four hours plus from the airport, and the drive only begins to get interesting about an hour outside of Denpasar. It’s actually an odd location for a resort of this standard, tucked in a mostly rural area between a small village and a recovering mangrove forest. Be forewarned: aside from the somewhat grubby, black-sand expanse of nearby Pemuteran, there are no beaches here and any sun worship is to be done by two refreshing, mildly saline pools (one of which is just long enough for laps if you have the wherewithal). Unless you have your own transport, you are at the mercy of the hotel for exploring the surrounding area, which is not a bad thing as the genial owner, Tony, is an amusing, calm and informative guide. To this end, we had an formidable day’s snorkeling off of Menjangan island from the hotel’s private jetty (lovely soft corals, varied fish life but overall the reef’s a bit degraded from overuse—still, a worthwhile visit and we would have loved to have seen the temple in action on a High Holy day), a mildly interesting guided ramble, organized by the resort, barely inside the national park (wish we would have taken a more challenging trek that went a bit deeper than, erm, the mangroves by the side of the highway, sorry) and a frankly revelatory trip to some temples off the beaten path as shown to us by Tony.

Other than that, this is a place to relax, unwind and rejuvenate. The food is simply stunning: varied, gourmet, with local and European delights, tailored to your tastes. There were excellent salads, gorengs, local seafood, satay (had the chicken at least three times), delicious cocktails, wicked puddings— some of the best food I’ve ever had on holiday… this does, however, come at Western Metropolitan prices, which is understandable given the quality and the remote location but still a bit of a sting. Expect to pay about 150,000-200,000 Rp for lunch and 180,000- 350,000 Rp for dinner, pp, including drinks.

The staff are relaxed, efficient and unfailingly polite—
genuine smiles all around, and we felt grateful to be included in their New Moon ceremony at the resort’s private, well-kempt temple. Our room was kept spotless, generally cleaned from top to bottom before we’d finished breakfast, the grounds were immaculate and simply watching the wait-staff float gracefully across the lily pond with your dinner under metal cloches was a romantic and luxurious experience.

One major downside-- which to be fair has nothing to do with the hotel but does warrant a sidenote: maybe you’ve read about the mosques broadcasting calls to prayer five times per day? And maybe you’ve thought to yourself: no big deal, part of the local culture, I didn’t mind the mosques in Cairo or Morocco or where-ever... Then you’re shown a pair of earplugs in the nightstand by the bed at Santi Sari and think, Nah, it can’t be as bad as all that. And then it starts. At 4 am. And it is bleedin’ LOUD. Friday night is diabolical. And, sadly, the muezzin is not near as melodious as the guy in Cairo. And there are several of them. On competing, echoing sound systems. With feedback from the speakers. Needless to say, we did not convert. Though it made for some interesting discussions.

Final bits and bobs: there’s satellite TV, wireless access, few mosquitoes though they are around, Tony graciously let us use his computer to confirm our outgoing flights, there’s a little fridge with an honor system for drinks by the smaller pool, complimentary water was greatly appreciated, fine bath products, ample mossie nets, perfect little touches and amenities all around--- all in all an excellent way to experience this remote, sleepy little corner of Western Bali.
title: Atypical perfection amid the mangroves

photos.caption: have I mentioned how much we loved feeding the fish in the pond?
unlike the web-site photos, the place is seriously lush
odd location for such a lovely resort

text: My partner and I spent a wonderful 7 days at this beautiful hotel. This really is a get-away-from-it-all retreat, nestled in a quiet bay far away from the tourist centres of the south of Bali. We were upgraded to a stunning master suite with day beds inside and out (as well as a huge 'normal' bed, equipped with mosquito net).  The bathroom was luxury itself, half inside and half outside - twin wash basins, two showers and a huge granite outdoor bath, topped off with our very own garden and fishpond!  We spent many a lazy day on the huge pagoda-covered daybeds by the hotel's two pools and spoiled ourselves with Balinese massages - which I can highly recommend.  The service was excellent throughout. Our host Tony really couldn't have done any more for us. He arranged a fantastic snorkling trip to Menjangan island (a short boat ride from the hotel's private jetty), a trek in the nearby national park, and personally took us on a couple of trips to hidden away temples, rice fields and Pemuteran bay and turtle sanctuary.  The staff at the hotel were absolutely wonderful, always smiling and providing excellent service at all times. And the food was fresh and delicious. Virtually all seafood and vegetarian.  If you are looking for an off-the-beaten-track experience in Bali and like to be spoilt, this is the place to stay.
title: A beautiful retreat

text: We had such a wonderful stay at Santi Sari. The house was beautifully decorated, with attention to details such as Balinese woodwork, outdoor bath and your own veranda with views of the garden and the sea. The hotel arrange the transport and the car was very comfortable. 3,5 hours drive from Denpasar, across the mountains and its all worth it! You get away from the tourist areas and find a stunning landscape, views of Java and peaceful environment. You feel you´re the only guest (except for geckos). True luxury a million times better than the posh hotels in Ubud, great food and excellent service but there were little things that made it really special. For instance, there´s a filled fridge with cold drinks where you simply wrote down what you had taken instead of having to call room service. Two pools with views of the sea. Day beds to relax and hide from the sun. Highly recommend a boat trip to Menjangan. We snorkeled, but its also great for diving. Lots and lots of barracudas, clownfish, napolean, morena and octopus just spectacular!
title: memory for life

text: The words "relaxing" and "peaceful" are far too frantic to describe this little part of heaven on earth. The photographs on the web site really do not do Santa Sari justice as it is breathtakingly beautiful and makes you feel privileged to be allowed to stay there. The rooms/bungalows are immaculate with a level of design and finish that just puts a huge grin on your face every time you walk in or wake up. We stayed in Banyan 1 which had the additional attraction of a massive bath carved out of granite which was warmed by the sun, big enough for two and took a surprisingly short time to fill. Just the way to unwind after an exhausting few hours checking out the piles of cushions on the luxurious canopied daybeds, olympic-standard floating around in the pool, (take your pick of two) or a gruelling marathon session on the sun loungers. Dry off with a big fluffy towel and slip on the complimentary sarong (not quite David Beckham but I thought I looked good) while you summon the energy to put a few clothes on and ring for a couple of pre-dinner gin and tonics to be brought to your verandah. If you look particularly drained they will even pour your tonic for you. You then have to head to the pool side restaurant where you are relentlessly bullied by lovely, smiling, and attentive staff into eating delicious meals which are beautifully presented and served at a gentle pace allowing you time to savour the food and the views in equal measure. Eventually you have to summon your last vestiges of strength to walk back to your room but be careful as you might develop a nastily cricked neck trying to take in the countless millions of stars, as light pollution has not been discovered here yet. We cannot speak highly enough of this resort, so thank you Carole and your wonderful team who made us feel so welcome and who simply could not do enough to ensure that we wanted for nothing. Ten days had flown past in no time and saying goodbye to you all left a genuine lump in our throats.
title: "Simply superb"

text:
This incredible resort is an experience I can't rave enough about.
It has to be seen and experienced to be believed.

We both felt honoured to be staying at such a serene sanctuary.
There is a very special essence to Santi Sari.
I highly recommend it to everyone for rest and rejuvenation, healing or romance.
We stayed at Santi Sari for 4 nights during our holiday in Bali in March.  Santi Sari was definitely a highlight of our trip that we treasure.  After an extremely stressfully, exhausting working period a holiday was hoped would remedy our stressed out minds and bodies. This was more than accomplished at Santi Sari.

The serene surroundings include luscious gardens intermingled with daybeds, lotus pools, ocean mangrove views and 2 devine salt water swimming pools.
The restaurant has 5 star food and service with a creative western and Balinese menu.  This is really something not to be missed and we feel so appreciative to all who thought up these creative meals and poured so much love into them.
I must make special mention of the Basil, Lemongrass sorbet, my fav!

The luxurious suites have large, very comfortable beds making for the most restful sleep I've had in a long time.  We felt like royalty.  There is a lot of heart in everything at Santi Sari and that's why it really is a place of healing.  

The staff are a very big part of the heart felt warmth of Santi Sari.  Smiling, warm and catering to your every need with such peaceful joy it is touching beyond belief.

Thank you to all at Santi Sari.  We hope to return soon!!
title: It has to be seen and experienced to be believed.

text: Absolutely lovely! The time just slips by. Beautiful everthing. Closest to the best diving in Bali, fantastic rooms, delicious food, super service and the most amazingly peaceful ambience. Book today!
title: Paradise on earth

text: Words cannot describe just how amazing this hotel is. Situated in the less frenetic north west part of Bali, this boutique hotel is one of the few places in the world that we would revisit. We cannot fault the location, the rooms, the staff, the food and the management. Some have complained about the Muslim call to prayer early in the morning - rubbish! It didn't wake us up and anyway what do some travellers expect when they travel to foreign places?! As for the trip North it was amazing. The views were stunning alongside the fascinating window on everyday 'real' Bali life - not to be missed. Make sure you make this trip in daylight and allow time to stop at interesting places. Thank you Carole (and Tony who we didn't meet) for creating  this little corner of paradise.
title: Best hotel ever!

text:
Had a very pleasant stay at the Santi Sari. My wife and I were pleasantly surprised by the thought and detail that has gone into creating this most relaxing oasis from the somewhat chaotic Balinese infrastructure.
The staff were very well trained and attentive. Food was consistently very good. Salt-water swimming pools recommended. The owner(s) were on hand to provide a personal service and nothing was too much trouble.
Only Negatives were the early morning calls from the local mosques (though ear-plugs are thoughtfully provided) though this is prevelant throughout the Island.
Be aware also that it is a somewhat arduous trip from the airport (albeit through some stunning mountainous terrain and rice paddies). I would argue it's worth it as this coastal part of the island is much less developed than much else of the periphery.
Ideally you need transport to explore the local temples, get inland and mingle with the locals or if you want beach access (4 miles to Permuteran) as the sea access here is via mangroves
title: March 2012 Santi Sari in North West Bali

text: The hotel was far beyond our dreams. Fantastic garden setting, beautiful views of the sea, peace & tranquility and first class villa accommodation. Well done We will come again.
title: A dream come true

text:
We stayed here for 7 days and had a lovely time.  The staff are so friendly and cannot do enough for you.  The resort is beautiful and I would definitely recommend this place to stay to experience paradise in beautiful rural Bali.  We were lucky enough to be in Bali for a special Hindu holiday and tony, the owner, took us around the temples for the day.  This was a special experience that i will never forget.  

Would recommend wearing ear plugs as the very early morning call for prayer is extremely loud!!
title: Stunning!!!

text: The room, the staff, the food, the swimming pool... Everything was just perfect during the 3 nights we did spend there. This is the place to stay is this region of Bali
title: JUST PERFECT

text: A beautiful oasis, fantastic accommodation and surroundings, really nice staff, great for relaxing - a place we did not want to leave. The main buildings in traditional Balinese style surround a lotus pond, giving you an immediate sense of peace.
title: An oasis

text: amazing place, really beautiful serene space, the garden, the rooms,everything lovely. magical!
title: Magic of Bali

text:
This boutique hotel is absolutely amazing! The rooms are gorgeous, spacious and very detail-oriented. The entire hotel has an energy of peace, beauty, and tranquility about it. Rooms have many windows in them with sunshine & high ceilings. Cable TV. Beautiful romantic bathrooms. Pools are with salt water. 

The food at the hotel is delicious - home-made bread, pastries, jams, ice cream. Big variety on the dishes to suit all tastes. Many vegetarian dishes as well. 

Hotel staff is friendly and very helpful. 

Organized snorkeling trip by the hotel was an experience of a lifetime. 

And if you are very lucky - you will get a chance to meet the hotel owners - loveliest people i have met! 

My husband and I loved it so much that we went back there for the second time!
title: A hidden gem in North Bali. A must Visit!!!

text:
Absolutely brilliant. Extremely relaxing, luxurious, very welcoming. The perfect place to forget about everything, and let your stress go.
Your only worries should now be "what will I have for breafast? Everything looks delicious", "which pool should we dip into", "when should we take this snorkeling trip"?
All of the staff is wonderful, very very welcoming, attending to your every needs, always smiling and friendly. You'll be treated like kings and queens.
Rooms are wonderful. Outside bathrooms, 4-pole beds.
I can't stop raving about this gem. Just go...
title: Paradise on earth

text:
After a gruelling 30 hour journey we arrived in the dark. Our exhaustion seemed to disappear once we showered and changed and took in our first glimpses. We ate on that first night relishing our surroundings and anticipating our 8 nights of luxury.

Tony was our host, we did not meet Carole with whom I had made the booking. He is very likeable and we spent a lot of time together, he was kind enough to take us on an outing along the coast which we really enjoyed. Lovina we liked and had afternoon tea in the german bakery which is also a deli. Just to the right there is a new shop which sells jewellery, it is very cheap and I wish I had bought more.

It was the slow season in november and after the first night we were "home alone" so to speak. Never before have we had 50 staff to attend to us and of course they all knew our names so we felt very spoiled. The first few days we relaxed by our pool,  which was a joy to swim in. My husband took up residence in one of the many gazeebos, reading and dozing!!
We did the snorkelling trip which was very good, fantastic corals, but the water visibility was not so good for seeing big fish. Mu husband did see a stingray though. Nano, our guide, snorkelled with us ensuring safety and the best spots. Very good idea!

We ate in the restaurant as there really is nowhere else nearby. The menu however is varied enough and there was normally a different fresh fish. The restaurant staff are delighful, all local, and  speak english. The MD, Gday(sorry about spelling) is very well travelled having worked on cruise ships for a time before "going home" to be with his family. He invited us to a Hindu Ceremony in the temple in the hotel grounds. It was a unique experience, attended by all the staff. A memory to treasure.

My husband had his first ever massage which wiped him out for 2 days! Mine included using the local fresh aloe vera, my skin has never been so soft.

It was husbands birthday and the staff carved the words on a fresh coconut for him. After dinner a chocolate fondant pudding was sculpted into a beautiful birthday cake. He does not normally have a sweet tooth but deemed it to be delicious.

Carole and Tony have put so much into this place striving for the perfection they demand. The suites are large and luxurious, the bed the most comfortable we have ever slept in, 2 showers and a bath, a daybed inside and one on the terrace.The views over the sea are dreamy and now the wallpaper on my phone so I never forget. The photos on the website hardly do it justice. I am pretty hard to please but could not fault it. The staff are trained to meet their high standards, and obviously enjoy working in such a superb environment.

We drove through the Bali most people know, or have visited, and were so pleased to have found this little corner of paradise.
title: Absolutely Fabulous!

text:
What a place!!! Most people's idea of Bali is the crowded cluttered streets of Kuta........... The Santi Sari is truely a gem away from the hustle of Tourist Bali..  A truely Magical Place. A few hours north of Kuta and Seminyak you drive through wonderful countryside- mountains, rice paddies, small villages....... then back down to the Northern Ocean side of the Island. 
On arrival, we were greeted by very friendly staff who gave us a tour of the property. THe gardens are tranquil and peaceful..... no wonder as the property was developed with Sacred Love of the surroundings.Two pools a lovely dining/bar area, an International menu that emcompasses many cuisines, will leave no one wanting to leave. 
They also have a private island that is off shore for sunning and snorkling........... 
The rooms are large and open, very clean and inviting.
Truely an amazing spot on an incredible Island!!!! Worth the drive??? You bet!
title: A gem at the Top End

text: I stayed there with my friend from Switzerland and we had a great time, the staff was very friendly and helpful. The rooms are spacious and out of this world, in a peaceful setting with nice gardens and as there were not many guests we had our own swimming pool. there are two in total, one in front of the Restaurant which serves great Breakfast, it is a really nice place to spend some quality time in Bali. We did the Boat trip to Menjangan, one of the best spots I have seen in Bali, being living here for seven years. The guides were very helpful as I am not really into snorkeling but they helped me through my fears and showed me the wonderful underwater world, like swimming in an aquarium!! Then picnic on the Beach, little rest and back to our wonderful Hotel. If you plan a trip in Bali - don't miss this Spot!
title: Soooo beautiful and peaceful

text:
We discovered Santi Sari by coincidence on our trip through Bali.
After a beautiful trip from the south of Bali to the north we arrived in the village Permuteran in the late afternoon. We started looking for a nice place to stay for just a few days. There are a lot of hotels in this area but we just could not find what we were really looking for. We decided to drive back to an other village near Permuteran but on our way through Permuteran we saw a sign from Santi Sari Boutique Hotel. We decided to check it out and we are glad we did!!! To describe Santi Sari in words is not easy because for us Santi Sari is so much more than just a fantastic and beautiful hotel; it's an experience that you will never forget. It may sound really cliche but this hotel is heaven on earth! The owners Carole and Toni from the UK have build this hotel together with the local community. The staff is excellent and genuine friendly. The rooms are beautiful and relaxing and they all have a great vieuw over the mangrove. The hotel has a beautiful garden were you can lay down on the poolbeds or relax in one of the gazebo's and listen to the songs of tropical birds. The 2 pools, with biologically treated seawater that feels like silk on your skin, have a great view over the mangrove and the ocean. Every afternoon you are treated with a spectacular show of swallow birds diving over the pool. The restaurant, overlooking the pool, serves excellent dishes and the staff makes sure that you are terated like a king. The hotel has a private boot that brings you to the best snorkling and diving spot of Bali, Menjangan island. So if you are looking for privacy, peace, great food, great massage's, pure nature and the real Bali smile then you should visit Santi Sari for sure!! Eventually we stayed 10 days at Santi Sari Boutique Hotel and we will go back!!

Kimm & Maurice (from Holland)
P.S. We know Bali very well and we have been in a lot of hotels not only in Bali but all over the world. This hotel stands out for many reasons; it's firts class in many ways and we recommand it to everybody who is looking for a very special place.
title: Santi Sari, a hidden dream in the north of Bali!

text: This hotel is fantastic! We were staying at mimpi springs hotel and it was not the place for us... after a dinner at Santi Sari we decided to stay there instead. We had such a great stay! The hotel is beautiful, the staff are amazing, the food is delicious, the snorkeling trip they took us on was the best snorkeling trip of my life. Thanks to the owners for being so welcoming, we will see you soon for sure!
title: A gem located in the most beautiful part of Bali

text: We want to thank Tony for giving us the chance to experience the absolute high lite of our trip to Bali. It was just perfect, the setting, the place, the rooms, the staff, absolutely everything about this hotel was just great. The place breathed serenity and peace, a better place to relax both body and soul will be hard to find...a life time memory !
title: A lifetime memory

text: Staying at Santi Sari was by far the highlight of our 2 week vacation to Bali. It's not common to find a place that we would consider paradise - but this is it. From the moment we arrived we were graciously welcomed and immediately felt relaxed and at home. The level of service is like no other as it is run by some of the nicest and kindest people you will ever have the pleasure of meeting. The onsite restaurant is truly gourmet and world class. We highly recommend going on their private boat to explore and snorkel. Santi Sari will always be remembered as one of the most special places we have visited.
title: We found paradise

text:
As usual when when planning our trip to Bali we looked at the Trip Advisor reviews having heard about Santi Sari from another source. Our initial reaction was "too good to be true" however it lived up to all our expectations.
From the moment we were greeted by the serene and elegant Carole and her colleagues we were made to feel at home. It was like arriving at a friend's country house. Indeed that is the atmosphere that Carole has managed to create. She has very cleverly blended truly excellent service with a discreet but friendly approach. Everything on the surface is calm and relaxed and it's not until you get to know Carole better you realise how hard she has worked to create this little piece of heaven.
We chose to stay in Palm 2 which is on the upper floor and has the most amazing views in all directions. It's a stunning suite which blends amazing Balinese fittings with modern facilities including excellent air conditioning.
We stayed for 8 nights and very quickly felt at home to the point that we didn't want to leave. For someone who finds it hard to relax, within 24 hours I was completely into the tranquil rhythm of the place whether it be simply chilling on the balcony or by the pool or enjoying the delicious food. 
The staff are just wonderful. They are young and sometimes a little shy but that adds to their charm. Unlike many places in Bali they are truly friendly not at all complacent or jaded by demanding guests.
Because Santi Sari is so cleverly laid out with, in effect, two separate pools and poolside areas its often hard to believe that there is anyone else there other than at meal times when one can choose to be a deaux or be more social and join in conversation with Carole and her other guests.
An absolute must whilst at Santi Sari is to take advantage of the hotel boat and dive guide, Nana and take a trip to Menjangan Island to snorkel or dive. I was a very nervous swimmer but had always wanted to snorkel. I decided that this was the time and put my trust in Nana to whom I will always be truly grateful for enabling me to enjoy this underwater paradise. His calm and friendly manner gave me total confidence and I overcame my fears within moments especially knowing that he was right by my side if I felt at all uncomfortable .
So sitting at a Uk airport in the grey and rain I find myself with a smile on my face as I transport my mind back to this magical place called Santi Sari !
title: Just wonderful

text:
We stayed at Santi Sari for 8 days this summer and had a truly wonderful time. Carol, our hostess was warm and friendly,  nothing was too much trouble for her and her fantastic team.  We had many adventures, perhaps the most memorable was a sunset trip to Menjangan Island. 
The leve of comfort was outstanding and our room was one of the best we have ever stayed in, I particularly loved the fresh blue and white decor which was so relaxing.  The food is excellent and candle lit dinner time round the pool is a treat.  Perhaps the nicest thing of all was being brought the best chocolate cake and cups of Earl Grey tea as we lounged on the comfy day bed by the beautiful pool.  The gardens, the flowers, the lotus pond and the little temple all add to the aura of peace and tranquility.
title: beautiful, tranquil and happy

photos.caption: the santi sari boat at menjangan sunset trip with volcano on Java behind
each suite is a whole floor of this building!

text:
Very nice staff
Superb kitchen
Great suite (we had the Lotus 4, mastersuite)

Santi Sari was the best hotel we had in our tree week stay in Bali!
We can't wait to go back :-)
title: Super great!

text:
First of all, we arrived by night, exhausted about our long trip/visit day all around Bali. We just wanted to have a good and long night... 
The welcome let us to thing that our stop in this hotel will be perfect.
Indeed, this hearty welcome was exceptionnal: a traditional balinese blessing that we won't forget!
The staff was particularly gentle and helpful about our arriving.
We were stunned! 
Everything is perfect over there. 
The menu is a mix between european and balinese dishes, therefore everybody can eat want he likes. The food is just fantastic! We ate the best 'fondant au chocolat' ever!! It was amazing.
The place is sumptuous.
Quiet, peaceful, relaxing, the suites -which are absolutely fantastic- are all surround with trees with a lot of wonderful and colorful flowers. 
HEAVENLY!!
Special mention to Carol who is an amazing person, thanks for everything!!
It was just 'insane'.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Pour commencer, nous sommes arrivés de nuit, épuisés de notre longue journée de voyage et de visites à travers Bali. La seule chose que nous voulions était de pouvoir passer une bonne et longue nuit...
L'accueil nous a laissé penser que notre séjour dans cet hôtel serait parfait.
En effet, ce chaleureux accueil fut exceptionnel: une bénédiction traditionnelle balinaise que nous n'oublierons jamais! 
Le personnel était particulièrement gentil et généreux.
Nous étions époustouflé! 
Là-bas, tout est parfait.
Le menu est un mélange de plats européens et balinais, par conséquent tout le monde peut manger ce qu'il aime. La nourriture est simplement fantastique! Nous avons manger le meilleur 'fondant au chocolat' de tous les temps. Il était stupéfiant! 
L'endroit est somptueux.
Calme, paisible, reposant, les suites -qui sont absolument fantastiques- sont toutes entourées d'arbres avec de merveilleuses et vives fleurs.
PARADISIAQUE.
Mention spéciale pour Carol qui est une personne extraordinaire, merci pour tout.
C'était juste 'dément'.
title: An unforgettable memorie / Un souvenir inoubliable

photos.caption: Viem from the suite / Vue de la suite
No lies, the best ever / Pas de mensonges, le meilleur

text:
Me and my partner stayed at Santi Sari for two days and we would highly recommend this boutique hotel to all.  Our room was spacious, very clean and had the most incredible outside views.  The air conditioning worked a treat and we had a gazebo, swimming pool and eating area right on our doorstep.  The hotel restaurant is situated right next to a lotus pond, once again great views. The hotel also has a temple on site, we were invited to a ceremony and got a real feel for the Balinese Hinduism religion.  I also tried a Balinese massage from the hotel’s spa and it was literally the best massage I’ve ever had – at such a great price too!  The hotel has their own private boat and carries out trips to Menjangan Island; we went snorkelling and later had the time to explore the Island, which was beautiful! We saw spectacular views on the way there, on the Island and on our way back and even passed a bat cave and a beautiful sea temple, which was very interesting to see.  My partner caught glimpses of flying fish which unfortunately I kept missing as I was distracted by the beautiful mountainous scenery, can’t complain with that!
 
The hotel owner (Tony) was very kind and took the time to help us plan the rest of our journey, which we are very grateful as his recommendations were spot on.  The staff were also incredibly friendly, so friendly in fact, that when asked if we wanted to try some coconut juice, a staff member climbed a palm tree (unaided) to go and get us some!  To sum it up, I hate to sound cheesy but this was pretty close to paradise.
title: Highly Recommend A Stay

text: We loved the hotel.  Just happened to call in and once you get past the road a " shangri la" awaits. Rooms amazing.  Beautifully proportioned, great beds, air con works to perfection, showers flood you, lots, and I mean lots, of space to relax in  and nothing out of place. The atmosphere of tranquality and peace which gradually enfolds you as you walk from reception only gets stronger. The grounds have been crafted to perfection.  Places to hide and meditate and places to socialise. Lovely pools. Its hard to believe its only 10 months old. The food was as the sign said "gourmet". Great selection and cooked and presented to perfection. The staff... well what can one say.  So lovely, friendly and welcoming.  From the blessing at the time of checking in to the farewell we felt like special guest of a great big "family". Just happened to mention I liked green coconuts and they were waiting when we returned from diving.  We went diving with Nana and Giday and had a great day. They were so kind and friendly. Fish life mind blowing. Right up there with the Great Barrier Reef and more fish than most Pacific islands we have been to.  A special thank you to Carol who made us feel more than just a couple of dusty kiwis arriving on a scooter.. Would we go back. Sure. Just a littlle thing.  Would be nice to have a small frig in the room for cold water.
title: We could'nt believe what we had found.

text: يستحق التجربة لقد أخذت عدد من الليالي فيي الفندق واحببته جدا ... وجهات النظر والديكور ممتازة، والموقع هو خاص جدا والطعام لطيف جدا جدا. أحبه هناك ... ذلك يستحق البقاء أو مجرد زيارة تستمر مع وجبات الطعام ..
title: أحب هذا المكان

text: Nous avons passé 4 jours de rêve dans ce palace de style indonésien. Nous étions seuls dans cette immense propriété comprenant 10 villas individuelles dans un parc de 7 hectares. Nous occupions la suite Lotus 1 de 120m2, avec une salle de bain intérieure, une douche extérieure dans un petit jardin, une grande terrasse avec lit de repos. La piscine à débordement est à l'eau de mer, sans produit chimique. La salle à manger donne sur la piscine. Possibilité d'excellent massage balinais. Possibilité de faire de la plongée ou du snorkelling avec le bateau privé de l'hôtel. Accueil exceptionnel.
title: Le paradis sur terre

photos.caption: Vue depuis la salle de massage du 1er étage
Piscine à côté de la salle à manger
Piscine (il y a en a deux)
Lit de repos dans le jardin
Salle à manger en bord de piscine
Salle de bain avec baignoire et vue extérieure sur le jardin privé
Lit au centre de la chambre adossé à un bureau

text:
Jacques Brel en a rêvé, Carole et Tony l'ont fait!
Santi sari boutique boutique hôtel est plus qu'un hôtel, c'est la concrétisation d'une vision, la patience de voir les choses grandir, pousser, évoluer, l'amour du partage, celui que j'ai pu ressentir de la part de l'équipe qui vous accueille dans ce lieu très particulier. 
Je suis venue ici guidée par ma soeur Mona qui a éveillé en moi la curiosité de venir le découvrir et par mes enfants et mon mari, attirés par le snorkeling. 
J'y suis arrivée sans attente particulière sinon celle de séjourner dans un bel endroit, attente entièrement assouvie tellement le lieu est particulier de part son emplacement, au bord d'une mangrove de la mer de Bali, en face d'une île aux bienfaits divins et entourée de fonds marins aussi riches en couleur qu'en diversité.

Le lieu est paradisiaque, la végétation luxuriante, les frangipaniers disputent la vedette aux cocotiers et ponctueront tous vos pas de la douceurs de leurs pétales roses, jaune ou crème. Les verts des feuillages des arbres de la mangrove sont un écrin pour l'eau bleue qui scintille au loin et qui rythme le bateau au bout de la passerelle en bois qui vous conduira à l'île si vous souhaitez découvir la faune sous-marine. 

Tony, le maître des lieux, est omniprésent, et il a su transmettre sa façon d'être là pour chacun de ses guests à route son équipe dont vous sentirez  le regard  discret et bienveillant à chaque  moment. C'est cela qui fait que je me suis sentie privilégiée pendant mon séjour de 3 jours, d'autant plus qu'étant tombée malade, j'ai pu bénéficier des remèdes magiques de Tony, pharmacien de formation, mais passionné d'homéopathie. 
J'étais venue sans attentes particulières, je l'ai déjà écrit, mais je suis partie enrichie de cette rencontre spéciale, de vue fabuleuses sur la mer depuis les différents beds extérieurs toujours fleuris de frangipaniers, rassasiée de bonne cuisine, réchauffée de chaleur humaine. 
Je voudrais aussi signaler l'énorme attention portée par Yasrawi le manager au sourire ensoleillé, ainsi que la délicatesse de l'accueil siti Fatimah et Indah qui vous isole du monde en quelques secondes, la présence discrète et adorable de Kariani, Mesi, Sukawati, Utin et Arini, au restaurant ou le service se fait dans les règles de l'art et la jolie vaisselle, et ou les tables sont dressées au bord de la piscine au bleu de rêve,  ainsi que le professionnalisme du jardinier qui nous a appris à planter des noix de coco en leur tranchant le côté. 
Merci à tous, 
Je ne sais pas si je reviendrais à Bali, mais j'emporte ce bout de Bali dans mon coeur.
title: Un domaine ou l'amour sera Roi, ou l'amour sera Loi

text:
Eines der persönlichsten 5 Sterne Häuser das ich kennenlernen durfte! 
Die Eigentümer haben sich persönlich um unser Wohlbefinden gekümmert. Selten so etwas erlebt....und das ganze auf eine sehr unaufdringliche Art und Weise.
Tolle Suiten mit viel natürlichem Touch und Ruhe in einer fast menschenleeren Bucht machten die Tage zu einem unvergesslichen Erlebnis. Der Ausflug zum Menjangan Schnorchelgebiet mit dem Hauseigenen Boot war perfekt organisier....
Vielen Dank An das Team und die Besitzer des Santi Sari!!!
title: Traumhaft

text:
Mrs Carole vous accueille chaleureusement dans cette belle maison en bord de la mangrove ,avec un charme so British .Immense propriété ( 7 hectares ),avec deux piscines à eau de mer,un cadre agréablement végétalisé ,un calme environnant ,un joli cheminement pour rejoindre le ponton d'où un bateau vous amènera vers de magnifiques spots de plongée .Le soir venu ,de savoureux repas vous seront servis .
Pour un séjour privilégié ,à découvrir absolument .Le personnel très attentif et stylé saura rendre ce séjour inoubliable .
title: Chaleureux accueil dans un endroit unique !

text:
Quel bonheur de séjourné au Santi sari hôtel . Une belle expérience à vivre. Calme , Luxe . 
Le goûter composé de sandwich balinais , cake et autres mets délicieux est un moment exquis
Le snorkling dans l'ile est incroyable. Vous plongez dans un aquarium géant
title: Un paradis

text: Magnifique séjour au Santi Sari, dans un beau jardin tropical calme et reposant. Personnel attentionné tout en sachant rester discret. Activités intéressantes dans la région, notamment très belle session de snorkelling au départ direct du ponton privé de l'hôtel. Chaleureux remerciements à Tony, propriétaire de l'hôtel, pour ses nombreuses attentions, ses précieux conseils, sa gentillesse et l'amour qu'il porte à sa région, qu'il sait partager et transmettre à ses convives. Nous reviendrons!!
title: Séjour de rêve au nord de Bali

text:
Endroit paradisiaque, accueil chaleureux, propriétaires charmants qui nous ont conseillés d'excellentes excursions.

Les chambres sont magnifiques, les piscines dans des cadres de rêves et très bien entretenues.

Ce lieu est magique, un seul regret, devoir le quitter
title: Un petit coin de paradis

text:
Estivemos hospedados por 3 dias no hotel, experimentamos o snorkelling ao redor da ilha e foi excepcional, levaram-nos no barco privado do hotel. O coral está intacto e tem grande variedade de peixes, inclusive o peixe-palhaço, o famoso Nemo. 
O hotel foi desenhado com grande cuidado, tem grandes detalhes da cultura hindú, até possui o seu próprio templo!
As piscinas de água salgada são óptimas para relaxar, uma delas com uma vista deslumbrante sobre a baía.
Os quartos estão impecavelmente decorados, e segundo a tradição balinesa, os sapatos ficam à porta.
Os donos do hotel, Carole e Tony, são extraordinários. Fomos muito bem recebidos por Carole na chegada, que nos mostrou o hotel e nos falou da sua paixão por Bali e pela cultura hindú, no nosso último dia no hotel jantamos todos juntos para assistir a um magnífico espectáculo de dança balinesa e fogo de artifício.
Neste hotel há um cuidado e proximidade com os hóspedes que nos faz realmente sentir em casa. 

Obrigado
title: Santi Maravilha Sari

text: Super endroit paradisiaque ! On y mange très bien ! Le propriétaire et les employés sont très gentils et serviables ! L'endroit est magique ! Seul bémol; l'hôtel est entourée de mosquées donc préparez-vous à entendre l'appel à la prière à partir de 4h45 le matin et cela perdure pendant quelques heures et ce plusieurs fois par jour !!! Le son est très fort car véhiculé par de puissants haut-parleur !!! Oreilles sensibles, s'abstenir !
title: Site paradisiaque !

text: Waren hier helaas maar twee dagen om te snorkelen op menjangan. Maar hadden graag wat meer dagen gewoon willen chillen in dit mooie hotel. Door de kleine opzet, de oprechte bediening, die geen vraag teveel is, en de aanwezigheid van de eigenaar was het geweldige ervaring.
title: Pracht boutigue hotel

text:
Nous avons passés deux nuits exceptionnelles au Santi Sari. Ce lieu est simplement extraordinaire. Le cadre est splendide et très bien entretenu. Vous pourrez ainsi vous relaxer au bord de la piscnie avec vu sur l'océan.  Carole et Tony possède egalement leur propre bateau qui permets de faire une excursion pour vous rendre sur l'ile et y faire du snorkling sans passer par les nombreuses agences de Pemuteran.
Les repas sont copieux et surtout de très bonnes qualités. Les chambres sont spacieuses, impeccable, harmonieusement décorés avec un très bonne literie pour passer une bonne nuit au calme.
Pour résumé tout est parfait et on a plus envie de repartir... 
Nous recommandons vivement cet hotel et nous remercions Tony, Carole et toute l'equipe pour leur accueil chaleureux.
title: Au TOP!!!

text: Au bout d'un chemin de terre se niche un des plus bel hôtel de Bali.Nous sommes accueillis par Carole et Tony,les charmants propriétaires .Nous avions réservé deux chambres ,mais afin que notre  fils soit parfaitement à l'aise ils nous ont gracieusement offert une troisième chambre pour la durée de notre séjour.Ce geste nous a vraiment touché.Les chambres sont magnifiques,la vue idéale,la cuisine excellente .Dans l'après midi se déroule"l'afternoon tea" au bord de la piscine ,un vrai bonheur.Une ombre au tableau pourtant:les musulmans venus de Java s'implantent sur cette partie de Bali et avec eux les mosquées et leur puissants haut parleur.Dès 5 heures du matin ,à moins d'avoir le sommeil profond,vous serez réveillé par les appels à la prière pouvant durer de 5 minutes à une heure et ce plusieurs fois par jour.
title: Hotel exceptionnel

text: Ci siamo fermati per pranzo al ristorante dell'hotel e siamo rimasti stupefatti della tranquillità e pace, l'ottimo sevizio e qualità del cibo. La piscina a vista con l'oceano e tanta natura intorno. Se passate da queste parti anche solo per pranzo vale la pena una sosta! Eccellente!
title: Beautiful place

text:
Bom, primeiramente quero agradecer o carinho que recebi nesse hotel :) como me alegra chegar em um lugar novo e ser muito bem recebida, pessoal com Um sorriso lindo, simpáticos e sempre dispostos a te ajudar e atentos para que tudo estivesse perfeito!!! Isso é maravilhoso .
O lugar é lindo lhes dou o parabéns, poder estar rodeada de verde, flores, mar e aromas é um privilégio...
Enfim essa foi minha primeira vez em Bali, ficamos 3 dias em Santi Sari,e vou levar boas recordações de nossa hospedagem, quero agradecer a Toni e Carol pela atenção, e por nos dar a oportunidade de desfrutar de seu paraíso e sem falar que nos deram boas dicas de mergulho e passeios pela região!! Adoramos.
No restaurante pude apreciar um dos melhores pratos que provei em Bali :) sem falar que a vista do restaurante é um luxo, esta justo ao lado da piscina de frente para o mar !!! Todas as tardes tomava um chá apreciando a vista !!! 
E o que mais tenho a agradecer é que no dia que estávamos indo embora esqueci minha bolsa na recepção do hotel... Estávamos de carro e já tínhamos saído do hotel e nem me dei conta que estava sem a bolsa, uns minutos depois uma moto se aproxima e começa a buzinar pra chamar a atenção, paramos o carro e vemos que se aproxima um dos meninos da recepção do hotel com a minha bolsa para me entregar...Nossa que alívio , fiquei muito surpresa e feliz pela atitude e estou muito agradecida por isso!! 
Se eu gostei ?
Amei e esperamos voltar no próximo ano!!
title: Linda recordação de Bali

text:
Un sejour inoubliable a maints egards.
Nous fumes royalement accueillis par le sourire de Carole, ce qui laissait presager d'un merveilleux sejour.
Le but de notre sejour etait de passer les fetes de Noel en amoureux, loin de l'agitation de Kuta, etre pres de la Nature et profiter - dans un endroit agreable - des diverses excursions possibles dans la region.
Nous avons eu en plus un immense plaisir de discutter avec les proprietaires Tonny et Carole, qui - en plus d'etre incroyablement accueillant et chaleureux - nous ont organise toutes nos excursions selon nos attentes et meme plus.
L'hotel est situe au bord de la mangrove.Le jardin s'etend jusqu'a la mangrove. Tonny se fera un plaisir de vous expliquer l'equilibre de l'ecosysteme (ils ont contribue a mettre en valeur la zone, et nous y sommes sensibles, car proches de la nature, ecologie, etc..) et vous aurez le plaisir de vous promener dans le jardin et la mangrove. Vous embrasserez aussi les montagnes environnantes. Ce lieu a vraiment une aura particuliere.
les suites sont parfaitement integrees au jardin et nous avons particulierement apprecie la vue sur le jardin et la baie, depuis la terrasse.
C'est toujours un plaisir de se promener pieds nu sur un sol en bois tropical. La chambres etait decoree avec gout: un lit confortable en bois avec baldaquin pour supporter la moustiquaire. des meubles en bois aussi. La salle de bain fantastique, avec une baignoire en pierre massive, retenant la chaleure de la journee pour la restituer le soir lors d'un bain delicieux, avec les nombreuses fleurs de frangipanier flottant a la surface. Un bassin avec des poissons dans le petit jardin de la salle de bain pour completer la sensation d'apaisement.
Le restaurant est situe au bord d'une des nombreuses psicine, avec vue sur la mangrove. Vous pouvez vour refugier dans l'immense  salon a l'etage pour admirer la vue sur la baie.
Le petit dejeuner offrait un choix varie, ainsi en est il de la carte pour les dejeuners/diners.
Rien a redire au noveau service, avec l'eternel sourrire et gentillesse balinais.
Au niveau excurssions, il ne faut surtout pas manquer la plongee/snorkelling autour de l'ile de Menjangan (plutot 2 fois qu'une!), un des rares spots encore preserve a Bali.
Mais aussi les nombreuses balades dans les forets tropicales  environnantes, faisant partie du parc nationnal. Appreciable, pour une fois en Indonesie, de ne pas avoir la nature souillee pas des sacs plastiques :o(
Tony nous a fait gagner un temps precieux en organisant a merveille les excurions, avec des gens de confiance et serieux (emerveillement garanti), ce qui n'est malheureusement pas toujours le cas en Indonesie.
Nous regrettons juste de ne pas avoir pu voir le lever de soleil sur la baie (le temps etait couvert), au bout de la jetee.
C'est sur, nous reviendrons!Et nous gardons de merveilleux souvenirs, que ce soit des excursions ou de nos discussions/echanges avec Tonny et Carole
title: sejour inoubliable

text: Het hotel is zo wonderlijk mooi dat je adem stokt .De kamers zijn feeriek, de omgeving verbluffend . De kamers , de zwembaden , het personeel , de natuur en de sportmogelijkheden in de buurt zijn echt de moeite waard .
title: Uitzonderlijke prachtige locatie !

text: Exceptionnel! cadre incroyablement zen et paisible qui contraste avec le sud et centre de Bali,  Emplacement intéressant pour la plongée et les randonnées dans le parc naturel proche, disponibilité du personnel avec une gentillesse naturelle, Restera un des meilleurs souvenirs de notre séjour indonésien.
title: Au bout du chemin "le paradis"

text:
Magnifique hôtel caché derrière un petit chemin de terre à 3 km du port de Pemuteran (départ pour les plongées et le snorkeling sur MENJANGAN).

"Chambre-Villa" parfaite, personnel balinais aux petits soins et adorable (full english), cuisine surprenante et exceptionnelle pour Bali ... et la propriétaire (anglaise) adorablement anglaise :) see you !

A recommander ... surtout le couché de soleil sur la petite jetée
title: Havre de Paix

text:
Ce boutique est exceptionnel. Situé loin des agitations de la partie sud de l'île, vous êtes immédiatement enivrés par les vibrations qui émanent du lieu. L'atmosphère et le calme de l'endroit nous ont pénétrés des les premières secondes : un cocktail enivrant qui ne nous a pas lâché durant tout notre séjour a Bali. 
Les suites sont décorées avec un goût certain et de manière raffinée, le service est irréprochable et l'accueil fait par Carole et Tony est unique. 
Également les activités proposées vous feront découvrir un spot exceptionnel pour le snorkling, le parc national situé a quelques kilomètres sans oublier le Spa et ses massages revigorants.
Enfin, les petits plats prépares par le chef sont succulents.

Nous y retournons très très vite !!!
title: Immanquable tout simplement !

text: Un superhotel con un trato excelente por parte del personal, que resuelve todas tus dudas y te hacen sentir mejor que en casa. La excursion de buceo fue increible, te llevan cuando quieras con su bote y disfrutas de una variedad increible de peces sin el agobio de otras excursiones organizadas que vas con mucha gente. Los masajes geniales, superrelajantes.... La unica pega por poner alguna cosa negativa de nuestra estancia es la distancia desde el aeropuerto, pero merece la pena la tranquilidad del sitio. No tengo palabras suficientes para agradecer a todo el personal del hotel lo bien que nos trataron. Muchas gracias Toni por todos tus consejos de actividades y hospitalidad.
title: IMPRESIONANTE!!!

photos.caption: Piscina al lado de la habitacion
Zona exterior de la habitacion , 2 duchas, y bañera
En la recepcion, ultimo dia, os echamos de menos

text:
Un personal maravilloso, Toni un 10 de 10, 
7 dias de ensueño

Un lugar especial, con gente especial.

los amaneceres , los atardeceres , 
vale cada rupia que pagas.

Toni, mil gracias por todo
Enjoy this paradise.

nota ... no admiten dólares 

Restaurante

la unica pega ... no hay carnes en el restaurante, ( solo pollo )
pero es en casi toda la isla,
así que podemos pasar sin ella  por unos días, excelente pescado del día.

recomendamos 

.snorkel en la isla frente al Santi Sari
.un paseo con Toni viendo las plantas , los pájaros, y el manglar.
.y disfrutar del sonido de los pájaros al amanecer

bueno espero que disfruten tanto como nosotros :)
title: ummmhhhhh ..The Paradise

text:
Ce boutique Hotel a un charme fou, c 'est une perle dans un écrin de verdure..
L'ambiance y est très spéciale.. magique je dirais, très reposante et agréable.. on n'a plus envie d'en partir...
Les chambres sont superbes, très claires et avec des bow windows superbes.
Le restaurant est central et a une magnifique vue.. et on y mange très bien avec un service parfait.. ( je vous recommande le fondant au chocolat!) mais tout le reste était excellent.

Nous y avons passé deux jours et nous aurions aimé rester 10 jours tellement c'était bien!

La cerise sur le gateau est que Tony l'un des propriétaires était là et c'est un homme charmant, serviable et qui respire la bonté et la sérénité... vraiment sympa!!

Bref moi qui suis une personne exigeante j'ai été séduite par cet endroit!!
Je vous le recommande vivement, vous serez ravis!!!
title: Essence de paix magique!!!!

text:
j'ai passé un super séjour dans cet hôtel. Reposant, déstressant, luxueux et convivial, cet hôtel a beaucoup de charme. 
l'eau salée des deux piscines est apaisante. la vue de la chambre est fantastique, le restaurant exellent et le personnel très compétent. 
Le service est maximum. 
Je me suis sentie comme une princesse et je recommande cette expérience à tout le monde et notamment toute personne recherchant le calme.
title: un petit coin de paradis pour trouver calme et sérénité
